0.title: Mumbai auto unions to protest on May 17 demanding CNG price reduction
0.article_body: Auto-rickshaw unions in Mumbai will go on a day-long protest outside Mahanagar Gas Limited office in Bandra Kurla Complex on May 17 demanding a reduction in CNG prices. Auto-rickshaw unions are also demanding a ₹2 hike in base fare. "We expect around 5,000 drivers to turn up for the protest," said Mumbai Auto Rickshaw Taximen's Union President Shashank Rao.

1.title: 2 Mumbai homebuyers to get 7 times the price of undelivered flats
1.article_body: About 27 years after they booked flats in City Builders' City Embassy project in Kopar Khairane in Navi Mumbai, Gul Achra and Kanta Achra will receive ₹91 lakh and ₹88 lakh respectively as the builder failed to complete the project. While Gul had booked a flat worth ₹12.56 lakh in November 1995, Kanta had booked another flat for ₹13.16 lakh.

2.title: DC defeat PBKS by 17 runs, move to 4th position on IPL 2022 points table
2.article_body: DC defeated PBKS by 17 runs at the DY Patil Stadium in Mumbai to move to the fourth position on the IPL 2022 points table. DC and RCB now have 14 points each, with DC having a superior net run-rate (NRR). Mitchell Marsh top-scored for DC with 63(48), while DC fast bowler Shardul Thakur took four wickets in the match.

3.title: He has some superpowers, is GOAT in tennis right now: Swiatek on Nadal
3.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek praised Rafael Nadal, saying he's the "perfect role model" and the "Greatest of All Time" (GOAT) in tennis right now. Recalling Nadal's 2022 Australian Open victory when he came back from two sets down against Daniil Medvedev, Swiatek said he has some superpowers, just never gives up, physically, tactically, he's always there on the court.

4.title: Thomas Cup winners Satwiksairaj-Chirag pull out of Thailand Open
4.article_body: Thomas Cup 2022 winning duo Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty have pulled out of the Thailand Open Super 500 tournament, beginning Tuesday, in Bangkok. It is, reportedly, learnt that Chirag suffered some niggles during the tournament and the pair decided to withdraw. The world number eight pair had lost just one match in India's first-ever Thomas Cup title-winning campaign.

5.title: Uber launches robot-assisted food delivery service in 2 US cities
5.article_body: Uber on Monday said it has launched pilot food delivery services with autonomous vehicles in two cities in US' California. It announced one food delivery service using autonomous cars and a separate pilot using sidewalk robots. Both services are available to users in Santa Monica and West Hollywood and can be opted out of.

6.title: SEBI bans Urja Global, 4 people from securities market for 2 years
6.article_body: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has banned energy provider and operator, Urja Global, and four individuals from dealing in the securities market for two years. It found that Urja Global made a false and misleading scheme for a corporate announcement in connection with Nippon Shinyaku. Various other disclosure lapses were also observed.

7.title: 'Doctor Strange' actress Zara jailed for 8 yrs for sexually abusing 13-yr-old girl
7.article_body: 'Doctor Strange' actress Zara Phythian has been jailed for sexually abusing a girl who was aged between 13 and 15 years. The 38-year-old's husband Victor Marke (59) has been jailed for 14 years for abusing the same victim and for the indecent assault of another girl. They were found guilty of 14 counts of sexual activity with a child.

8.title: Sri Lanka plans to privatise national airline to help pay off debt
8.article_body: Sri Lanka's new PM Ranil Wickremesinghe on Monday proposed privatising national airline Sri Lankan Airlines as part of reforms aimed at paying off the economic crisis-hit country's debts. "It shouldn't be that this loss has to be borne by the poorest of the poor," Wickremesinghe said. He added that the airline made a loss of SLR 45 billion in FY21.

9.title: Fire breaks out at shoe factory in Delhi, 9 fire tenders rushed to spot
9.article_body: A fire broke out at a footwear factory in Delhi's Narela industrial area on Monday, Delhi Fire Service officials said. Nine fire tenders have been rushed to the spot, officials added. So far, no casualty has been reported in the incident. The fire was reportedly brought under control and 10 workers were evacuated safely.

10.title: They want to muddy the topic: Jeff Bezos on US govt criticising his recent tweets
10.article_body: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos tweeted, "They understandably want to muddy the topic," on the White House's statement about his tweets opposing taxing the rich corporations to tame inflation. It accused Bezos of opposing an "economic agenda for the middle class that cuts some of the biggest costs families face". Earlier, Bezos accused US President Joe Biden of "misdirection" over inflation.

11.title: Cricketer Shikhar Dhawan to make his acting debut soon: Report
11.article_body: Cricketer Shikhar Dhawan will reportedly make his acting debut in a film. "The makers felt that Shikhar suits the character and reached out to him a few months back," a source close to the development was quoted by Pinkvilla. "It's a proper full-length role and is not a cameo. His part is pivotal to the film," the source added.

12.title: Punjab witnessing complete breakdown of law and order: SAD's Badal
12.article_body: Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) President Sukhbir Singh Badal on Monday said Punjab is witnessing a complete breakdown of law and order. "Instead of providing relief to the common man, CM Bhagwant Mann is holding phony photo-ops...If this is the badlav (change) that AAP promised, then Punjabis are in for one of the worst phases in the state's history," Badal added.

13.title: Akash Madhwal replaces Suryakumar Yadav in Mumbai Indians squad
13.article_body: Mumbai Indians have signed Akash Madhwal as a replacement for Suryakumar Yadav, who was ruled out of IPL 2022 owing to a left forearm muscle injury. Madhwal is a right-arm medium-fast bowler and has represented Uttarakhand across all three formats of the game since making his domestic debut in 2019. He was a part of MI's support team.

14.title: Nadal is my biggest opponent between him and Federer: Djokovic
14.article_body: Acknowledging his rivalry with Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal, world number one Novak Djokovic said that 21-time Grand Slam champion Nadal is the biggest opponent of his career. "I have grown as a player because he [Nadal] has pushed me to it," he added. Djokovic leads Federer 27-23 and Nadal 30-28 in head-to-head on the ATP Tour.

15.title: Insulting: Mishra as IAS officer jokingly credits India's Thomas Cup win to mosquito racquet
15.article_body: Veteran cricketer Amit Mishra reacted to IAS officer Somesh Upadhyay jokingly crediting India's Thomas Cup win to a mosquito racquet. Somesh shared a picture of a mosquito racquet and wrote, "Indonesian are surprised how Indians got better at badminton than them." Mishra responded, "This is not only distasteful but also insulting the achievement of our badminton heroes."

16.title: DC opener Shaw should make a comeback when he's 100% fit: Nikhil
16.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Nikhil Chopra has said DC opener Prithvi Shaw, who was admitted to hospital due to typhoid a few days back, should make a comeback in the team in ongoing IPL if he's feeling 100% fit. He added that if Shaw plays without proper practice sessions, the team will lose him for playoffs if they qualify for the same.

17.title: Pics of Bajrang Dal arms training in K'taka trigger probe, 'used air guns', says Dal
17.article_body: Pictures of a week-long Bajrang Dal arms training camp in Karnataka went viral online, following which the police said that an investigation is being done. The camp with 116 participants was organised in Kodagu and weapons like Trishuls (tridents) were distributed among them. Bajrang Dal, however, said that only air guns were used and the Trishuls distributed 'weren't sharp'.

18.title: 34-yr-old man rapes 11-yr-old girl who ran away from home in Maha
18.article_body: The Vasai police in Maharashtra arrested a 34-year-old man on Sunday for allegedly kidnapping and raping an 11-year-old girl who had gone missing on Saturday, officers said. She took a local train to Mumbai before deciding on returning home. However, she met the accused who raped her before leaving the girl on the road, police said.

19.title: Govt puts Pawan Hans sale on hold over concerns about winning bidder
19.article_body: The Centre has decided to put on hold the sale of its 51% stake in Pawan Hans Limited to Star9 Mobility. The decision was taken after concerns were raised over Almas Global Opportunity Fund, one of the majority stakeholders of Star9 Mobility. NCLT had sanctioned Almas Global over its failure to pay after successfully bidding to acquire Kolkata-based EMC Limited.

20.title: Shailesh Lodha to quit 'Taarak Mehta Ka...' after 14 yrs: Report
20.article_body: Actor Shailesh Lodha, who plays the role of Taarak Mehta in 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah', will reportedly be quitting the show after almost 14 years. As per a report by ETimes, Shailesh has not shot for the show since the last month and won't return to the show as he is not happy with his current contract.

21.title: Punjab CM Mann launches 'Lok Milni' for grievance redressal of people
21.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann heard the grievances of the people and issued directions for their redressal in a public interaction programme, 'Lok Milni', which was launched on Monday. "This is a humble step of my government to make sure that we facilitate resolution of long-pending administrative issues concerning people," he said.

22.title: Maintain peace, don't disturb environment: Lekhi to Mufti, Owaisi
22.article_body: Union Minister of State for External Affairs Meenakashi Lekhi on Monday told AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi and former Jammu and Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti to "maintain peace and brotherhood" and "not disturb the environment". This came after Mufti and Owaisi commented on the Varanasi Court's order to seal the place of the Gyanvapi Mosque where a Shivling was found.

23.title: B'luru Police chief Kamal Pant transferred, CH Pratap Reddy to replace him
23.article_body: The Karnataka government on Monday transferred Bengaluru Police Commissioner Kamal Pant with immediate effect. CH Pratap Reddy, who held the post of Additional Director General of Police, Law and Order, will replace him until further orders. Pant has been transferred to the post of Director General of Police, Recruitment.

24.title: Entire world is watching, be sensible as a leader: Shami to Hardik
24.article_body: Revealing what advice he gave to GT skipper Hardik Pandya, teammate Mohammad Shami said he told him to control his emotions on the field "because the entire world watches cricket." He added that it's important to be sensible as a leader and he has witnessed a lot of changes in Hardik as a captain in comparison to a player.

25.title: Chlorine gas leaks during water tank demolition in WB, 15 fall ill
25.article_body: Fifteen people fell ill in West Bengal's Murshidabad after chlorine gas leaked during the demolition of an old water tank reservoir in the district's Public Health Engineering Department. A fire official said the incident took place after JCB machines at work "broke the reservoir by mistake". Two patients, who were severely ill, were shifted to a hospital in Berhampur.

26.title: Artistes can succeed only by keeping regional feelings aside: Nagarjuna
26.article_body: Nagarjuna, while hosting 'Bigg Boss Telugu Non-Stop', criticised contestant Nataraj who asked viewers to not vote for co-contestant Bindu as she's from Chennai, adding he'll entertain the audience as he's part of the Telugu industry. Nagarjuna told Natarajan artistes can succeed when they keep their regional feelings aside. "90% film industry was in Chennai before the states split," he added.

27.title: India overtakes Germany as 4th largest vehicle market: Report
27.article_body: India surpassed Germany to become the world's fourth largest automotive market in 2021, data by the Organisation Internationale des Constructeurs d'Automobiles (OICA) showed. As per the data, India saw 3,759,398 vehicles sold in 2021, compared to 2,973,319 vehicles in Germany. The most number of vehicles were sold in China, followed by the US and Japan.

28.title: Warner changes end at last second to face Livingstone, gets out on 1st ball; video viral
28.article_body: DC opener David Warner changed his end at the last second to face PBKS Liam Livingstone on the first ball of his team's innings and got out on the first ball. DC's Sarfaraz Khan was ready to face the first ball, however, Warner decided to take strike after knowing Livingstone was bowling the first over.

29.title: No shivling found, there's only a fountain: Gyanvapi Mosque Committee's lawyer
29.article_body: Rais Ahmad Ansari, an advocate of the Anjuman Intezamia Masjid Committee that manages the Gyanvapi Mosque, has called petitioners' claim about a 'Shivling' being found at the mosque "misleading". "There's only a fountain in the mosque's wazu khana," Ansari said. His statement came after a court in UP's Varanasi ordered the sealing of the spot where 'Shivling' was reportedly found.

30.title: Elon Musk considers visit to Indonesia over possible investments
30.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk is considering a visit to Indonesia to explore investment opportunities. As per Indonesian President Joko Widodo's office, Musk said to Widodo, "Hopefully in November...thank you for the invitation," after the two met in Texas on Saturday. Indonesia, which has some of the largest nickel deposits, has been in talks with Musk's team over electric vehicles development.

31.title: Don't remember last OTT show I was excited about: Abhishek Banerjee
31.article_body: Abhishek Banerjee, speaking about the OTT platforms, has said, "There is a saturation which is definitely going to come in." "I don't remember the last show which I was excited about...also the kind of shows which come your way, you don't see the excitement level which we saw probably in projects we've done," he added. Abhishek starred in 'Paatal Lok'.

32.title: No merit: Aditya Birla Capital on report claiming corruption caused CEO's exit
32.article_body: Aditya Birla Capital (ABC) on Monday said outgoing CEO Ajay Srinivasan is transitioning to a new role being crafted at the group level. This comes after a news report, citing a whistleblower letter, alleged that Srinivasan was asked to leave due to corruption, insider trading and front running. "These insinuations/allegations are bereft of facts," said the ABC spokesperson.

33.title: Fire breaks out at shelters for Central Vista project workers, no casualties
33.article_body: A fire broke out in three temporary shelters for workers involved in the Central Vista project near Parliament House in central Delhi on Monday, officials said. No casualties were reported in the incident, they said, adding that mattresses and household items were destroyed in the fire. Five fire tenders reached the spot and doused the blaze within an hour.

34.title: Unwarranted comments: India on Islamic nations' remarks on J&K delimitation
34.article_body: India on Monday criticised the Organisation of Islamic Cooperation (OIC), calling its comments on the delimitation exercise in Jammu and Kashmir "unwarranted". "OIC should refrain from carrying out its communal agenda vis-a-vis India at the behest of one country," said the External Affairs Ministry. The 57-member OIC had criticised India over the delimitation exercise during a meeting in Pakistan.

35.title: China building infrastructure near Arunachal border: Indian Army
35.article_body: Indian Army's General Officer Commanding-in chief of the Eastern command Lieutenant General RP Kalita on Monday said China's People's Liberation Army is engaged in infrastructure capacity enhancement across the international border in Arunachal Pradesh. Border villages built by Chinese authorities can be used for dual purposes, he said. "We are continuously monitoring the situation," he added.

36.title: Rahul’s comments on regional parties bizarre, out of sync: RJD
36.article_body: Responding to Rahul Gandhi's comments on regional parties, Rashtriya Janata Dal on Monday said that his comments were bizarre and out of sync with Congress' own declaration. In his address at his party's 'Chintan Shivir' in Udaipur, Gandhi had claimed that regional parties cannot fight the BJP-RSS as they lack ideology. Congress can fight it, he said.

37.title: Fearless Arshdeep flourishes under pressure situations for PBKS: Harbhajan
37.article_body: Calling Arshdeep Singh a "fearless bowler" with a "lion's heart", ex-India spinner Harbhajan Singh said the PBKS pacer has the quality to flourish in the pressure situations in ongoing IPL. "There's so much confidence in this bowler and the belief that he can do well during tense moments...he bowls yorkers at will in the death overs," he added.

38.title: BCCI announce squads for 2022 Women's T20 Challenge
38.article_body: The BCCI have announced squads for the 2022 Women's T20 Challenge. Harmanpreet Kaur, Smriti Mandhana and Deepti Sharma have been named captains of Supernovas, Trailblazers and Velocity, respectively. The Women's T20 Challenge will begin with the Trailblazers taking on Supernovas in the opening game on May 23. The final will take place on May 28.

39.title: Wife forcing husband to separate from parents amounts to mental cruelty: HC
39.article_body: If a wife continuously insists that her husband separate from his parents and threatens to implicate him in a false dowry demand case, it would amount to mental cruelty, the Chhattisgarh HC ruled. It said this while hearing a man's petition challenging the order of a family court, which had rejected his plea to seek divorce on grounds of cruelty.

40.title: Muslims not ready to lose another mosque after Babri Masjid: Owaisi
40.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said that Muslims aren't ready to lose another mosque after Babri Masjid, following the Varanasi Court order to seal the place in the Gyanvapi Mosque where a Shivling was found. "This is a textbook repeat of December 1949 in Babri Masjid. This order itself changes the religious nature of the masjid," he said.

41.title: I won't lie, next couple of months to be most difficult ones: Sri Lanka PM to citizens
41.article_body: Sri Lanka's new PM Ranil Wickremesinghe on Monday warned the economic crisis-hit country's citizens, "The next couple of months will be the most difficult ones of our lives." He added, "I have no desire to hide the truth and to lie to the public." He said Sri Lanka's budget deficit stands at SLR 2.4 trillion (13% of the country's GDP).

42.title: Tamil Nadu CM writes to PM Modi over rising prices of cotton, yarn
42.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin on Monday wrote to Prime Minister Narendra Modi seeking his immediate intervention to solve the "serious disruptions" faced by the textile industry in the state. Stalin said despite the Union government withdrawing import duty levied on cotton, the prices of cotton and yarn have been continuously on the rise.

43.title: Anjali & I being close in 'Lock Upp' wasn't easy for Nazila: Munawar
43.article_body: 'Lock Upp' season 1 winner Munawar Faruqui has revealed that his closeness with co-contestant Anjali Arora on the show was not easy for his girlfriend Nazila Sitaishi. "Nazila went through a lot of emotions, but in the end, she understood the game and supported me," he stated. Munawar added that Nazila had "complete trust" in him.

44.title: Sri Lanka left with only one day of petrol stock, warns new PM
44.article_body: Sri Lanka's new PM Ranil Wickremesinghe in an address to the nation on Monday said, "At the moment, we only have petrol stocks for a single day." He said the crisis-hit country urgently needed $75 million in foreign exchange to pay for essential imports. "The next couple of months will be the most difficult ones of our lives," he added.

45.title: 4 killed as rains trigger landslides in Arunachal, 1 still trapped
45.article_body: Four persons were killed in landslides triggered by incessant rainfall in Arunachal Pradesh's Itanagar, police said. Itanagar SP Jimmy Chiram said a woman is still trapped under debris after a house collapsed due to the impact of a landslide, killing two people. "Rescue operations are going on to evacuate her," Chiram added. Three other persons sustained injuries in the incident.

46.title: I still hear screams & people begging for help: Mundka fire survivor
46.article_body: One of the survivors of the Mundka fire incident, Mamata, recounted her escape and said, "It is like a video continuously playing in my head. I still hear screams and people begging for help." The 45-year-old, who is a resident of Parvesh Nagar in Delhi, said she could still feel the smoke. Mamata suffered injuries on her hands and foot.

47.title: Felt really nice speaking to PM Modi after Thomas Cup win: Srikanth
47.article_body: India's badminton player Kidambi Srikanth has said that the Indian badminton team's first-ever Thomas Cup win is a victory for every Indian. Talking about speaking to PM Narendra Modi after winning the tournament, Srikanth said, "I...didn't expect that...It felt...nice speaking to him immediately after the match." He added PM Modi keeping a track of players and their performances is "amazing".

48.title: People of Nepal equally happy over building of Ram Temple: PM Modi
48.article_body: PM Narendra Modi during his visit to Nepal on Monday, said people of Nepal are as happy as Indians over building of a grand Lord Ram Temple in India. "In Janakpur, I'd said that 'Our Ram is also incomplete without Nepal'," he added. He said his birthplace in Gujarat's Vadnagar was also a great centre of Buddhist learning, centuries ago.

49.title: Felt that season didn't really start for us till first win: MI's David
49.article_body: Speaking about bottom-placed MI's form in IPL 2022, MI batter Tim David stated the season didn't start for them until they won their first match following eight consecutive losses. "Since then, we've played some really good cricket," he added. "We've won three of our last four games and there has been a good feeling in the team," David further said.

50.title: I'd rate myself as one of the favourites at 2022 French Open: Djokovic
50.article_body: Talking about his chances of winning the title at upcoming French Open, Novak Djokovic said he would rate himself as one of the favourites following his form in the last few weeks. The world number one won his first title of 2022 in Rome on Sunday. Before this, Djokovic lost in Serbia Open final and in semi-final in Madrid Open.

51.title: Adani offers to buy 26% of Ambuja, ACC for $6.5 bn after $10.5 bn Holcim deal
51.article_body: Gautam Adani has made an open offer to acquire a 26% stake each in Ambuja Cements and ACC from public shareholders for $6.5 billion. A day ago, Adani announced a $10.5 billion deal to acquire Holcim's India business. Notably, Holcim holds 63.19% in Ambuja Cements and 54.53% in ACC (of which 50.05% is held through Ambuja Cements).

52.title: Bharti accused of insulting Sikhs as her video mocking beards goes viral, apologises
52.article_body: Comedian Bharti Singh has been accused of hurting the sentiments of the Sikh community in an old video where she's heard mocking beards and moustaches. Following the backlash, Singh issued a video statement saying, "I haven't mentioned any religion or caste in the video...But if people from any religion...have been hurt...I apologise to them with folded hands."

53.title: Global wheat prices hit record high after India bans export
53.article_body: After India banned wheat exports earlier this week, wheat prices touched a new record high of €435 ($453) per tonne as the Euronext market opened on Monday. The prices had reached the previous record high of €422 on Friday, as supplies from Russia and Ukraine (both major wheat exporters) have been disrupted. Wheat futures traded in Chicago also rose 5.9%.

54.title: Russell is one of the guys who can do special things: KKR's Southee
54.article_body: KKR pacer Tim Southee has said that his teammate and all-rounder Andre Russell is having a "tremendous" IPL 2022. "There are a few guys around the world that can do special things and Andre Russell's one of those guys," he further added. In the ongoing IPL 2022, Russell has scored 330 runs and has taken 17 wickets in 13 matches.

55.title: World's second-largest economy China's retail sales fall to lowest in over 2 years
55.article_body: Retail sales of the world's second-largest economy, China, slumped to its lowest in over two years while factory output plunged, official data showed. It's the biggest slump since March 2020 as Chinese consumers remained mostly at home amid coronavirus restrictions. This also comes amid China and its business hub Shanghai adhering to strict coronavirus measures, negatively affecting supply chains.

56.title: IAS officer accused in ₹18cr fraud in J'khand sent to 4-day ED remand
56.article_body: A Jharkhand court on Monday sent suspended IAS officer and state Mining Secretary Pooja Singhal and her chartered accountant to four-day Enforcement Directorate remand. ED arrested Singhal on May 12 in connection with a money laundering case linked to the alleged embezzlement of ₹18-crore MGNREGA funds. "Data has been collected from digital devices and they'll be confronted," ED lawyer said.

57.title: Man makes fake FB ID of Amit Shah, makes abusive remarks against MLA
57.article_body: A man allegedly created a fake Facebook profile of Union Home Minister Amit Shah and made abusive remarks about former Baikunthpur MLA Mithilesh Tiwari. The incident came to light on Sunday after Tiwari lodged a complaint with the Mohammadpur Police. "We have arrested a person named Vicky Kumar Singh from Devkali village," said Anand Kumar, SHO of Mohammadpur Police Station.

58.title: Non-profit behind collapsed Terra ecosystem to compensate users
58.article_body: The Luna Foundation Guard (LFG), a non-profit organisation that supports the Terra ecosystem, on Monday announced that it will compensate the remaining users of TerraUSD/UST, after the stablecoin collapsed last week. "We're still debating through various distribution methods," the LFG tweeted. It spent millions of dollars worth of crypto trying to defend UST's dollar peg last week, it added.

59.title: B'luru Police chief Kamal Pant transferred, CH Pratap Reddy to replace him
59.article_body: The Karnataka government on Monday transferred Bengaluru Police Commissioner Kamal Pant with immediate effect. CH Pratap Reddy, who held the post of Additional Director General of Police, Law and Order, will replace him until further orders. Pant has been transferred to the post of Director General of Police, Recruitment.

60.title: Good news: UP Deputy CM on 'Shivling' being found at Gyanvapi Mosque
60.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Deputy CM KP Maurya on Monday said he was happy about reports claiming the existence of a "Shivling" at the Gyanvapi Mosque complex in Varanasi. "The truth has come to light. We will welcome and follow orders of the court in the matter," Maurya said. "The situation in Uttar Pradesh is very good. Everybody is happy," he added.

61.title: Centre should ensure security of Kashmiri Pandits: CM Kejriwal
61.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that the Centre should ensure the security of Kashmiri Pandits. "A Kashmiri Pandit was killed inside his office by terrorists. It seems it was planned. The Indian Army gunned down two terrorists in a day. But the incident has left Kashmiri Pandits scared," CM Kejriwal said in an online briefing.

62.title: Actress Ketaki's phone, laptop seized by police over FB post against Pawar
62.article_body: Marathi actress Ketaki Chitale, who was arrested two days ago over a 'derogatory' Facebook post on NCP chief Sharad Pawar, was on Monday brought to her home in Navi Mumbai by police to collect electronic evidence. Police were at her residence for an hour, where they seized her phone and laptop. Six cases have been filed against the 29-year-old actress.

63.title: PBKS to bowl first against DC, DC make 2 changes to their playing XI
63.article_body: PBKS captain Mayank Agarwal won the toss and elected to bowl first against DC in their IPL 2022 clash on Monday. PBKS are fielding the same playing XI, while DC have made two changes to their playing XI. Khaleel Ahmed and Sarfaraz Khan have replaced Chetan Sakariya and KS Bharat, respectively.

64.title: Brabourne Stadium is a tough place to bowl: RR pacer Trent Boult
64.article_body: RR pacer Trent Boult, who picked two wickets against LSG at the Brabourne Stadium, said that it is a tough place to bowl. Speaking about his performance, Boult said, "Nice to get wickets at the top. I've got a simple game with the ball." Rajasthan defeated Lucknow by 24 runs and Boult was adjudged Player of the Match.

65.title: US FDA warns Sun Pharma over quality lapses at Gujarat plant: Report
65.article_body: The US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has flagged production-related quality control and procedural lapses at India's largest drugmaker Sun Pharma's facility in Gujarat's Halol, it has been reported. The health authority reportedly also observed deficient equipment and laboratory standards. It conducted a good manufacturing inspection there from April 26 to May 9.

66.title: Pics of Taj Mahal's underground cells, before & after maintenance, released
66.article_body: The Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) recently released some photographs of the Taj Mahal's underground cells, showing the state of the rooms before and after conservation work. It said the maintenance work was undertaken in the rooms on the riverside and decayed and disintegrated lime plaster was removed. This comes amid a controversy over the 22 locked rooms.

67.title: Renault sells Russia business for 1 ruble to govt-backed entity: Reports
67.article_body: French automaker Renault reached a deal to sell its Russia business and its majority 68% stake in Russia's biggest automaker AvtoVAZ for one ruble, reports said on Monday. Renault's stake in AvtoVAZ would be sold to the state-backed Russian Central Research and Development Automobile and Engine Institute. Renault sold its AvtoVAZ stake with a six-year option to buy it back.

68.title: India-Nepal relations unshakeable like Himalayas: PM in Lumbini
68.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, speaking at the Buddhist Conference in Nepal's Lumbini, said the relationship between India and Nepal is "unshakable like the Himalayas". "The growing...friendship between India and Nepal will work for the benefit of entire humanity amid the kind of global situation that is emerging today," he added. "The devotion to Lord Buddha binds us together," the PM said.

69.title: SC directs IIT to award degree to 'learning disabled' student
69.article_body: Supreme Court has directed the Indian Institute of Technology, Bombay (IIT-B) to award a student suffering from 'learning disabilities' his degree in Master in Design, declaring that the student has successfully completed it. The bench of Justices directed IIT-B to take appropriate steps including handing over the degree and all other testimonials to the appellant, Naman Verma, within four weeks.

70.title: Every player stepped up when it mattered: Srikanth on India's Thomas Cup win
70.article_body: Shuttler Kidambi Srikanth, who remained undefeated in India's maiden Thomas Cup title-winning campaign, said his performance in final against Indonesia was one of his best. He added, "I don't think this is one individual's win, it's about all 10 players. Everyone stepped up when it mattered." Srikanth beat Jonatan Christie 21-15, 23-21 in third match, helping India beat Indonesia 3-0.

71.title: Stones hurled at Dalit man's wedding venue in MP, 5 arrested
71.article_body: A group of people allegedly threw stones at the wedding venue of a Dalit man in Madhya Pradesh, following which the marriage procession was taken out under police protection, an official said on Monday. A case was registered against 40 people, including 18 unidentified persons, while five were arrested, the official added.

72.title: IndiGo handled passengers inappropriately: DGCA as special needs boy denied boarding
72.article_body: DGCA on Monday revealed findings of its inquiry into the Ranchi incident, where a specially-abled boy wasn't allowed to board a flight. It said that prima facie, the airline staff 'handled passengers inappropriately'. The incident resulted in "certain non-conformances with the applicable regulations" by IndiGo, the aviation regulator said. It also issued a show-cause notice to the airline.

73.title: Not worried at all: Sourav Ganguly on Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's form
73.article_body: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly has said that he is not worried at all about the form of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli in IPL 2022. He added, "They are too good…real big players. The T20 World Cup 2022 is far away and I am quite confident that they will be in top shape much before the tournament."

74.title: No heatwave in Delhi for next 4 days: IMD
74.article_body: The ongoing heatwave in Delhi and other north Indian states will abate from Tuesday for the next four days, IMD senior scientist RK Jenamani said. On Sunday, Mungeshpur and Najafgarh observatories in Delhi recorded 49.2 degrees Celsius and 49.1 degrees Celsius respectively. "In May, the first 10 days were good...I don't think it'll be very unusual this month," he added.

75.title: 432 fined in 2 days for driving on wrong side of road in Gurugram
75.article_body:
At least 432 people were fined in two days for driving on the wrong side during a road safety drive launched by the Gurugram Traffic Police to reduce accidents in the city. 
According to traffic police officials, around 15% of the road fatalities in the city happen due to wrong-side driving. A fine of ₹500 is issued for wrong-side driving.

76.title: US-based customers use Tesla cars to mine $800/month in crypto
76.article_body: Tesla owners are using their cars as a power source to mine cryptocurrency. San Francisco-based Siraj Raval hacked his Model 3's onboard internal firmware to mine up to $800 worth of cryptocurrency every month. Wisconsin-based Chris Allessi connected a power inverter and a bitcoin miner to his Model S' battery to mine bitcoin and monero.

77.title: Actress Neena Gupta's autobiography to be adapted into a film
77.article_body: Veteran actress Neena Gupta has revealed that someone has "shown an interest" in adapting her autobiography 'Sach Kahun Toh' into a film. When asked about whether she has an actor in mind to play her onscreen, the actress said, "Mere kehne se kya hota hai (It doesn't matter what I say). The producer will decide who is fit for it."

78.title: 2nd-set tie-breaker was vintage him: Roddick on Djokovic's Italian Open win
78.article_body: Praising Novak Djokovic following his 6-0, 7-6(7-5) win over Stefanos Tsitsipas to clinch his record-extending 38th ATP Masters 1000 title at Italian Open on Sunday, ex-world number one Andy Roddick said, "Second-set tie-breaker was vintage Novak." The top-seed took an early lead in tie-break before Tsitsipas levelled the score. However, Djokovic converted on his very first match point at 6-5.

79.title: Pics of 'underground city' in Finland's capital surface amid Russian attack fears
79.article_body: Pictures of Finnish capital Helsinki's 'underground city' with hundreds of bunkers have surfaced online, amid fears of Russian retaliation against Finland's bid to join NATO. The underground city can reportedly shelter 900,000 people, a third more than Helsinki's population of 600,000 people, for months in case of a war. The hidden city has a swimming pool and a hockey rink.

80.title: WhatsApp Pay to display user's legal name to avoid UPI frauds
80.article_body: WhatsApp will now display users' legal name for every transaction they make on WhatsApp Pay to mitigate fraud on UPI payments system. The company said the name associated with a user's bank account, identified using their phone number on WhatsApp, is the name that will be shared. WhatsApp users have the choice to pick any name on the app.

81.title: Which Indian women wrestlers have qualified for Commonwealth Games 2022?
81.article_body: As many as six Indian women wrestlers have qualified for Commonwealth Games (CWG) 2022. Pooja Gehlot and Vinesh Phogat have qualified for the 50kg and 53kg categories, respectively. Meanwhile, Anshu Malik, Sakshi Malik and Divya Kakran have qualified for 57kg, 62kg and 68kg events, respectively. Pooja Dhanda will participate in the 76kg event at CWG 2022.

82.title: Water supply to be affected in parts of Delhi from tomorrow
82.article_body: Parts of Delhi will face disruption in water supply from Tuesday morning due to depletion of pond level of Yamuna river at Wazirabad and reduction in release of raw water from Haryana, Delhi Jal Board said. The water supply will remain affected till the pond level improves to normal. Kamla Nagar and Karol Bagh are among the affected areas.

83.title: Heard is a sociopath, wants to destroy Depp: His friend Gina Deuters
83.article_body: Johnny Depp's longtime friend and his business partner Stephen Deuters' wife Gina has said that Amber Heard "wants to destroy" ex-husband Johnny Depp. Gina further stated that Stephen called Heard "a sociopathic showbiz pony" when he was mediating the couple before their marriage ended. Depp is suing Heard for defamation following her claim of being a victim of sexual violence.

84.title: Autos in Gautam Buddha Nagar told to fix meter, end arbitrary fares
84.article_body: Auto-rickshaws without meters will not be allowed to ply on Noida and Greater Noida roads in a bid by Gautam Buddha Nagar transport department to stop them from charging arbitrary fares, officials said. Fitness certificate will also be mandatory for auto-rickshaws plying in the twin-cities. Legal action will be taken against erring drivers, Assistant Regional Transport Officer AK Pandey said.

85.title: Goldman Sachs allows senior employees to take unlimited leaves
85.article_body: Goldman Sachs will allow partners and managing directors to take as much time off as they want under a new "flexible vacation" to "rest and recharge", according to an internal memo. "As of May 1, there will be no cap on paid leave and senior staff can take time off without a fixed vacation day entitlement," the memo said.

86.title: Mumbai doctor assaulted, robbed by youth he met on gay dating app
86.article_body: A senior doctor was assaulted and his iPhone and wallet were stolen by four persons in Mumbai. The victim had met one of the accused on a gay dating application, where the accused youth asked him to meet him at a secluded place. "The accused targeted victims on dating application assuming they would not approach the police," an officer said.

87.title: 4 tourists killed, 3 injured as car falls into gorge in Himachal
87.article_body: Four tourists were killed and three others injured after an SUV in which they were travelling fell into a gorge in Himachal Pradesh's Kullu district on Monday. The car had a Delhi registration number, police said. The injured passengers, including two women, were admitted to a hospital, the police added.

88.title: Samantha shares 1st poster of 'Kushi', fans say 'Release in Hindi'
88.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu shared the first poster of her upcoming film with Vijay Deverakonda titled 'Kushi' on social media on Monday. The film will be releasing in four languages including Tamil, Telugu, Kannada and Malayalam. A social media user commented, "Sam why not in Hindi," while another wrote, "Hindi me bhi release krdo...Thodi daya krdo hum pr bhi."

89.title: Kuldeep Yadav & I can communicate without even speaking: Chahal
89.article_body: Yuzvendra Chahal, speaking about his relationship with spinner Kuldeep Yadav, has said, "I have the kind of bond with him where we can communicate without even speaking." In the ongoing IPL 2022, RR's Chahal is currently the purple cap-holder with 24 wickets in 13 matches so far. DC's Kuldeep has 18 wickets in 12 matches in the tournament so far.

90.title: PBKS are a more settled line-up with Bairstow at the top: Lisa
90.article_body: Ex-Australia cricketer Lisa Sthalekar has opined that Punjab Kings are a more settled batting lineup with batter Jonny Bairstow playing as an opener. "Bairstow's numbers opening the batting in the IPL are outstanding," she said. Talking about Bairstow's 29-ball 66 runs versus RCB, she said, "He's too much of a class player...we saw that at Brabourne Stadium against RCB."

91.title: Babil Khan shares pics with late father Irrfan, reveals motivation
91.article_body: Actor Babil Khan took to social media on Monday to share a series of childhood pictures with his father late actor Irrfan Khan and a picture of his mother Sutapa when she was pregnant. Babil wrote in the caption, "The motivation to endure the torment of being in this industry is stubborn because it's beyond personal desires."

92.title: Kiara not approached for Prabhas-starrer 'Spirit': Kiara's spokesperson
92.article_body: Earlier reports surfaced that Kiara Advani will be seen opposite Prabhas in Sandeep Reddy's film 'Spirit', however, Kiara's spokesperson confirmed that she hasn't been approached for the film. "In case of any update, we'd officially announce and inform everyone. Hence, kindly request everyone to refrain from indulging in the rumours," her spokesperson said.

93.title: DC's David Warner will be very valuable in match vs PBKS: Piyush
93.article_body: Piyush Chawla said DC opener David Warner will be "very valuable" in the match against PBKS. "Warner will play the big innings, holding one end for his team. He'll take all the pressure on himself...give others the chance to come and score quickly," Chawla added. Warner is IPL 2022's third-highest runscorer with 427 runs in 10 matches so far.

94.title: Activists block docking of ship 'carrying Russian diesel' in UK
94.article_body: Greenpeace on Monday said that its activists stopped an oil tanker carrying "33,000 tonnes of Russian diesel" from docking in the UK's Essex. The environmental organisation added that they did so in a protest against buying Russian fossil fuels which will "fund" the war in Ukraine. Meanwhile, the police said that eight people have been arrested in the matter.

95.title: PBKS should replace Harpreet Brar with Sandeep Sharma against DC: Chopra
95.article_body: Former India batter Aakash Chopra has suggested that PBKS should play with pacer Sandeep Sharma instead of left-arm spinner Harpreet Brar against DC on Monday. "If you look at Delhi's line-up, you will find (left-handers) David Warner, Rishabh Pant and Axar Patel as well...In the match-ups, Sandeep Sharma could be more than a handful," Chopra said.

96.title: Kejriwal trying to scare people over anti-encroachment drive: BJP
96.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal is trying to "scare and blackmail" people over the BJP-ruled civic bodies' anti-encroachment drive, Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta said on Monday. However, Bangladeshis, Rohingyas, rioters and those involved in illegal activities, “who are protected by the Aam Aadmi Party”, won't be spared, Gupta said. Centre has given ownership rights to 40 lakh people, he added.

97.title: Boring work for Namma Metro suspended 713 times due to geological conditions
97.article_body: The boring work for Namma Metro has been suspended 713 times due to unfavourable geological conditions. Underground rocks and rocky soil have made it more difficult for Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) to complete the Namma Metro's phase 2 underground section. Reports said cutter discs are worn out or there is a delay in installing suitable ones.

98.title: BJP after all our mosques: Mehbooba Mufti on Gyanvapi mosque case
98.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Mehbooba Mufti on Monday, while criticising the BJP-led central government over the Gyanvapi mosque case, said, "They are after all our mosques." "Our God is wherever we worship. Give us a list of all mosques you are eyeing," she added. "Would everything be okay when they take all of it?" the PDP chief asked.

99.title: Adani Group liable for fines on Ambuja Cements & ACC; no tax liability for Holcim
99.article_body: The Holcim Group has said that there will be no indemnity or tax liability for them in its $10.5 billion transaction where it sold its stake in Ambuja Cements and ACC to the Adani Group. The Adani group is now liable for anti-trust fines against Ambuja Cements and ACC in India which are being litigated in the Supreme Court.

100.title: Hope it doesn't affect my car insurance: Alan Ritchson on joining 'Fast X'
100.article_body: Alan Ritchson, who plays Jack Reacher in series 'Reacher', has joined the cast of 'Fast X', the 10th instalment in the 'Fast and Furious' franchise. The actor, in an Instagram post, confirmed the news, writing, "Really hope this doesn't affect my car insurance." The film, directed by Louis Leterrier, will also feature Vin Diesel along with Jason Momoa and others.

101.title: You make everything better: Katrina on husband Vicky Kaushal's b'day
101.article_body: Actress Katrina Kaif wished her husband, actor Vicky Kaushal on his 34th birthday. Taking to Instagram, Katrina shared pictures with Vicky from New York along with a message. She wrote, "New York wala birthday. My love. Simply put, you make everything better." Reacting to the post, Vicky wrote, "Shaadishuda wala Birthday!"

102.title: Took 50 wickets in last 10 Ranji games, Test cricket is still my priority: Chahal
102.article_body: India spinner Yuzvendra Chahal, who's yet to make his Test debut, has said that playing the longest format of the game is still his "first priority". He added, "I [took] 50 wickets in my last 10 Ranji Trophy matches...I think being called a Test player has a different aura." Notably, Chahal last played a first-class match in December 2018.

103.title: Married woman stabbed to death by former lover in Andhra's Bapatla
103.article_body: A married woman was allegedly stabbed to death by a man, with whom she allegedly had extramarital relations in the past, in a village located in Andhra Pradesh's Bapatla district. The deceased, identified as Sharada (27), was chased by the accused, identified as Padma Rao, who ran away after stabbing her neck, the deceased's mother alleged.

104.title: Forest fire breaks out near Kasauli's air force station; 4 injured
104.article_body: A forest fire that broke out near the air force station in Himachal Pradesh's Kasauli on Sunday has been brought under control a day later, according to officials. Four people, including three firemen, were injured in the incident. "It was tough. The relentless efforts of the air force personnel and firefighters finally yielded result," the town's sub-divisional magistrate said.

105.title: Another grave mistake: Russia on Finland, Sweden's decision of joining NATO
105.article_body: Russia on Monday warned that decisions by Finland and Sweden to join the NATO military alliance were serious mistakes and Moscow would take measures. "This is another grave mistake with far-reaching consequences," Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Ryabkov said. "They should have no illusions that we will just put up with this," he added.

106.title: Wasn't easy to step into the shoes of Rannvijay: Sood on 'Roadies'
106.article_body: Sonu Sood, speaking about replacing Rannvijay Singha as the host of the show 'Roadies', said that it was not easy for him initially to step into the shoes of Rannvijay. "After shooting for 40-45 days in South Africa, I realised that I connected with the ex as well as new roadies and it was like a family reunion," he added.

107.title: Lack of rain to blame for intense, prolonged heatwave in Delhi: IMD
107.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) said that the lack of rain is the primary catalyst for the intense and prolonged heat spell across the region, with Delhi also not recording any significant western disturbances. A western disturbance is expected on Monday and on May 21, but they're unlikely to bring any rain, reports said.

108.title: Thieves return temple idols claiming they had 'nightmares' after theft in UP
108.article_body: Thieves have returned 14 of the 16 idols that they stole from an ancient Balaji temple in UP's Chitrakoot, police said on Monday. The idols worth crores were found in a sack near the Mahant's residence with a letter from the thieves, officials said. The thieves wrote they were having 'scary dreams' at night after committing the crime, they added.

109.title: Disgusting when people make fun of overweight & underweight people: Paresh
109.article_body: During an interview, actor Paresh Rawal said it looks "ugly and disgusting" when people make fun of disabled, overweight and underweight people. He added, "People who make a laughing stock out of such topics should be punished." Praising Kapil Sharma's style of comedy, Paresh said, "He has the capacity to bring laughter with...lines which have no humour in them."

110.title: Arshdeep is keeping big players like Dhoni, Hardik silent in death overs: Irfan
110.article_body: Former India cricketer Irfan Pathan has praised PBKS pacer Arshdeep Singh, stating that the 23-year-old is a special player, who's going to be the "next big thing" for the franchise. "He's keeping big players like MS Dhoni, Hardik Pandya or someone else silent in the death overs and that speaks volumes about the kind of talent he possesses," added Irfan.

111.title: Kourtney Kardashian and Travis Barker get legally married in California
111.article_body: Kourtney Kardashian and Travis Barker got legally married in an intimate ceremony in California's Santa Barbara on Sunday, reports said. Pictures from the ceremony have also surfaced online with Kardashian seen in a short white dress and Barker in a black suit. One of the pictures showed the couple riding in a car with a 'Just Married' sign.

112.title: Bitcoin has no future as a payments network: FTX's billionaire CEO
112.article_body: Cryptocurrency exchange FTX's 30-year-old billionaire CEO, Sam Bankman-Fried, has said that Bitcoin has no future as a payments network, Financial Times reported. The billionaire also criticised the digital currency for its inefficiency and high environmental costs. Later in a tweet, he clarified, "To be clear, I also said that it does have potential as a store of value."

113.title: Mahesh Babu's 'Sarkaru Vaari Paata' crosses ₹100-crore mark worldwide
113.article_body: Mahesh Babu's action drama 'Sarkaru Vaari Paata' has crossed the ₹100-crore mark worldwide. As per a tweet by production house Mythri Movie Makers, the Parasuram directorial has earned more than ₹103 crore at the worldwide box office. The film, which was released on May 12, also stars Keerthy Suresh, Nadiya Moidu and Sowmyaa Menon among others in pivotal roles.

114.title: Tesla recalls 1,07,293 China-made vehicles due to overheating
114.article_body: Tesla is recalling 1,07,293 China-made Model 3 and Model Y vehicles due to overheating that may cause the centre touchscreen display to malfunction, China's market regulatory agency said on Monday. As per the State Administration for Market Regulation, the overheating could also lead to windshield settings and gear displays malfunctions. Last week, Tesla recalled 1,30,000 vehicles in the US.

115.title: No one can harm AIADMK till I am here: Expelled leader Sasikala
115.article_body: Expelled AIADMK leader VK Sasikala has said that no one can harm the party as long as she is around. Speaking at a wedding ceremony on Sunday, she added, "Just as it [the party] recovered every time, the party will be revived and until then I will not rest." Sasikala urged party workers to be patient.

116.title: UP cow slaughter suspect's mother killed during raid, police booked for murder
116.article_body: A 50-year-old woman died after being shot during a police raid in a village in Uttar Pradesh. Police had gone to the village to apprehend the woman's son, a suspect in a cow slaughter case. The villagers allegedly attacked the police team with stones and fired gunshots, following which police opened fire. Unnamed police personnel have been booked for murder.

117.title: Shehnaaz to play the role of South Indian woman in 'Kabhi Eid...': Reports
117.article_body: Shehnaaz Gill will reportedly play the role of a South Indian woman in Salman Khan-starrer 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali'. Photos and videos of the actress from a shoot have gone viral on social media platforms. In a leaked video, reportedly from the sets of 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali', Shehnaaz is seen getting down from her vanity van in her costume.

118.title: Won't lie, there's a bit of pressure now: Rahul on LSG's loss vs RR
118.article_body: Following their 24-run loss against RR in IPL 2022, LSG captain KL Rahul said, "I won't lie, yes, there is a bit of pressure," as they are placed third on the points table. Notably, a win against RR would have guaranteed LSG a top-two finish. "We could've so easily been sitting today and could have qualified [for playoffs]," he added.

119.title: 50% of tourism in India is because of Mughals: Mehbooba Mufti
119.article_body: Former J&K CM Mehbooba Mufti on Monday said 50% of the tourism in India is because of Mughals. "BJP wants to destroy the tourism sector in India," Mufti added. "They are after all our mosques. They are after the Gyanvapi Mosque now. Our God is wherever we worship. Give us a list of all mosques you are eyeing," Mufti stated.

120.title: Over 41,000 people from 222 villages affected in Assam floods: ASDMA
120.article_body: The Assam State Disaster Management Authority (ASDMA) flood report has revealed that over 41,000 people from 222 villages have been affected by the recent flash floods and landslides that have occurred in the state. Notably, the report also said that around 1,685 affected individuals have been rescued and taken to relief camps.

121.title: Harsh Goenka lists 'Top 10 startup mistakes', includes poor hiring, lack of focus
121.article_body: RPG Enterprises Chairman Harsh Goenka tweeted a graph and captioned it as 'Top 10 startup mistakes'. As per the graph, the three biggest mistakes made by start-ups are building something nobody wants, poor hiring and lack of focus. These are followed by failure to execute sales and marketing, not having the right co-founders and chasing investors and not customers.

122.title: My character was a spoilt brat with wounded heart: Preity on 19 yrs of Armaan
122.article_body: As Preity Zinta's film 'Armaan' completed 19 years, she took to her Instagram handle and shared a video of the movie's song titled 'Mere Dil Ka Tumse' which also features actor Anil Kapoor. She wrote, "Uff! Armaan! This film was special in so many ways. I got to experience a complex 'Sonia', a psychotic spoilt brat with a wounded heart."

123.title: Win was satisfying, atmosphere is chilled, nice: Samson
123.article_body: RR captain Sanju Samson said that the win against LSG was satisfying and the atmosphere in camp is "chilled and nice". Samson, however, also added that it's not easy to maintain such an atmosphere when there are defeats. "Batting first suits our approach well, we want to bat positively...[as] the bowling unit is good," he further said.

124.title: Heavy traffic at Mumbai's Eastern Express due to closure of JVLR flyover
124.article_body: Heavy traffic jam has been witnessed since Saturday at Mumbai's Eastern Express Highway because of Jogeshwari-Vikhroli Link Road (JVLR) flyover being shut due to some ongoing repair work. A large chunk of the jam is being witnessed from Mumbai to Thane and Powai to Thane routes. The traffic jam will remain the same till May 24, officials said.

125.title: First commercial flight takes off from Yemen capital in years
125.article_body: Yemen's national airline on Monday flew its first commercial plane from capital Sanaa in almost six years. The flight, which was bound for Amman in Jordan, carried dozens of Yemenis, including patients travelling to get medical treatment. This comes after the UN brokered a two-month truce between the Saudi-led coalition and the Iran-backed Houthi rebels.

126.title: BJP govt destroyed economy, wants to create 2 Hindustans: Rahul
126.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday accused PM Narendra Modi of destroying the economy and said that BJP wants to create two Hindustans, with one for the rich and the second for Dalits and farmers. "The BJP government has attacked our economy. PM did demonetisation, wrongly implemented GST, due to which the economy got destroyed," he said.

127.title: 'The Kashmir Files' has given birth to hate in country: Farooq Abdullah
127.article_body: National Conference chief Farooq Abdullah on Monday said that he met LG Manoj Sinha to raise the issue of the law and order situation in Jammu and Kashmir. "During the meeting, I told him that the film 'The Kashmir Files' has given birth to hate in the country," Abdullah added. "Such things (films) should be banned," Abdullah stated.

128.title: Delhi policeman out to catch man in stabbing case stabbed by same accused
128.article_body: A Delhi Police official who had gone to catch an accused involved in a stabbing incident was stabbed by the same accused. The accused, Virender, stabbed head constable Praveen when he and Assistant Sub-Inspector (ASI) Sanjeev went to raid Virender's premises. The ASI then fired a shot in self-defence that hit Virender in the leg.

129.title: MGK dedicates BBMAs performance to 'wife' Megan Fox, 'unborn child'
129.article_body: Singer Machine Gun Kelly dedicated one of the songs from his performance at the Billboard Music Awards 2022 to his "wife" actress Megan Fox instigating rumours of the couple having married in a secret ceremony. The singer also dedicated a song to their "unborn child" which is being considered a pregnancy announcement from the couple by their fans.

130.title: McDonald's to exit Russia after 32 years, sell its business in the country
130.article_body: McDonald's on Monday said it's selling its Russian business, marking the American fast-food chain's exit from Russia after 32 years in the country. McDonald's cited humanitarian crisis caused by the Russia-Ukraine war, adding that its Russian business "is no longer tenable, nor is it consistent with McDonald's values". McDonald's has 850 restaurants in Russia that employ 62,000 people.

131.title: Hetmyer likely to be available for RR's game against CSK on May 20
131.article_body: RR's Shimron Hetmyer, who had left the bio-bubble to travel back to Guyana for the birth of his first child, has rejoined the squad and is likely to be available for their last league match on May 20 against CSK. Hetmyer missed matches against DC and LSG. RR defeated LSG on Sunday to register their eighth win of IPL 2022.

132.title: JD(U) fields Anil Hegde for Bihar Rajya Sabha by-poll
132.article_body: The Janata Dal (United) has fielded Anil Hegde as its candidate for the Rajya Sabha by-elections in Bihar. The by-polls were necessitated due to the demise of sitting JD(U) MP Mahendra Prasad in December 2021. Hegde, originally from Karnataka's Mangaluru, has been residing in Patna and working on strengthening the party's organisation for decades now, a JD(U) leader said.

133.title: Kareena poses with West Bengal Police as she shoots for Sujoy Ghosh's next
133.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor has begun shooting for Sujoy Ghosh's 'The Devotion of Suspect X' in West Bengal's Kalimpong. Photos from Kareena's visit to a local family's house have surfaced on social media. In the photos, Kareena can be seen sitting with a group of women. She also met the West Bengal Police as they all posed for a picture.

134.title: Director Lokesh confirms Suriya's cameo in Kamal Haasan's 'Vikram'
134.article_body: Lokesh Kanagaraj, director of Kamal Haasan, Vijay Sethupathi and Fahadh Faasil-starrer 'Vikram', confirmed during an event that Suriya will make a cameo appearance in the upcoming film. Kamal, who was also present at the event, thanked Suriya for graciously accepting the offer, despite being asked to join the shoot at the last minute. 'Vikram' will release on June 3.

135.title: NHRC team visits Mundka fire site to probe human rights violations
135.article_body: A team of the National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) visited the four-storey building in Delhi's Mundka where 27 people died in a massive fire on May 13. "It is the first day of the probe and it will progress as we get more facts," NHRC DG Sunil Meena said. The Commission took suo moto cognizance of the incident on Sunday.

136.title: Oppn parties have gone into overdrive against criticism: Pradhan
136.article_body: Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan tweeted on Monday that "champions of free speech today are [the] real threat to freedom of expression and plurality." He said that Opposition parties have gone into an "overdrive" against criticism and that people like NCP chief Sharad Pawar and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal have taken it "too far". "Is their esteem so fragile?" he added.

137.title: Flight makes emergency landing in Mumbai as drunk man misbehaves with air hostess
137.article_body: A Doha-Bengaluru flight was forced to make an emergency landing in Mumbai on Saturday after a drunk passenger allegedly created ruckus on board. Police said Sarfuddin Ulwar allegedly misbehaved with an air hostess when she tried to stop him from drinking and also abused fellow passengers. Ulwar was arrested and booked under the Indian Penal Code and the Aircraft Act.

138.title: Blaming India won't solve problem: Chinese media as G7 criticises wheat export ban
138.article_body: China has reportedly come to India's defence after the Group of Seven (G7) industrialised nations criticised it for banning wheat exports. "Blaming India won't solve the food problem," said Global Times, a Chinese government outlet. "Why won't G7 nations themselves move to stabilise food market supply by hiking their exports?" the Global Times asked.

139.title: Sri Lanka reimposes nationwide curfew till Tuesday morning
139.article_body: Sri Lanka will reimpose a nationwide curfew which will be in effect from 8 pm on Monday to 5 am on Tuesday. The curfew was lifted on Sunday on the occasion of the Buddhist festival, Vesak. More than 200 people have been reportedly arrested on various grounds, including violating the curfew, amid protests over the economic crisis in the country.

140.title: Manushi receives 'Prithviraj' outfit as gift from makers on b'day, shares video
140.article_body: Manushi Chhillar, who turned 25 on May 14, was gifted an outfit she wore on the first day of the shoot of her debut film 'Prithviraj'. She took to Instagram to share an unboxing video with a caption that read, "What a start to my Birthday. Thank you YRF (Yash Raj Films) and Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi (film's director)."

141.title: FirstCry halts $1 bn IPO plans amid market volatility: Report
141.article_body: E-commerce unicorn FirstCry, which was to file its draft IPO papers in May, has delayed its planned $1 billion initial public offering (IPO) by a few months, the Economic Times reported. The kids' marketplace is reportedly reevaluating the pricing and issue size. This comes following a muted response to Delhivery's IPO last week amid broader market volatility, the report said.

142.title: Hope we get a charter plane back: Chirag Shetty to Air India's tweet on Thomas Cup win
142.article_body: Responding to Air India's congratulatory message on the Indian men's badminton team winning the Thomas Cup for the first time ever, shuttler Chirag Shetty wrote, "Hope we can get a charter plane back!" Air India had tweeted, "Congratulations to the Indian Men's Badminton Team...This victory will give wings to the dreams of all young sportspersons of our country."

143.title: 7 buffaloes killed, 15 injured by unidentified persons in Thane
143.article_body: Seven buffaloes were killed and 15 others were injured by some unidentified individual or persons in the Bhiwandi area of Thane, police said. "The motive may be professional rivalry. A case has been registered and efforts are on to arrest the culprits," a police officer said. The incident took place in a cattle shelter in Bunder Mohalla.

144.title: Best thing for Sweden's security is to join NATO: PM Andersson
144.article_body: Swedish PM Magdalena Andersson on Sunday said that joining NATO is the "best thing" for the security of the country and its people. This comes after Andersson's party Social Democrats announced that it will work towards applying for NATO membership amid the Russia-Ukraine war. "We believe Sweden needs the formal security guarantees that come with membership in NATO," she added.

145.title: Adani Group to buy 49% stake in Quintillion Business Media
145.article_body: Adani's AMG Media Networks will buy a 49% stake in Raghav Bahl-run platform Quintillion Business Media Ltd (QBML) for an undisclosed amount. It signed a Shareholders' Agreement with Quintillion Media Ltd (QML), QBML and a share purchase agreement with QML, QBML and Quint Digital Media Ltd (QDML). In March, Adani Group said it will acquire a minority stake in QBML.

146.title: Neha Sharma, Aisha Sharma to create show 'Shining with the Sharmas'
146.article_body: Actress Neha Sharma and her sister Aisha Sharma will be creating a short-format content show about their personal lives for a social media platform titled 'Shining with the Sharmas'. The show will reportedly be along the lines of American reality television show 'Keeping Up With The Kardashians'. The show will capture their lives at the gym, photoshoots and their downtime.

147.title: PM signs sketch of him & Lord Buddha made by a boy in Nepal, video surfaces
147.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday autographed a sketch of him and Lord Buddha reportedly made by a  boy in Nepal's Lumbini. A video showed PM Modi signing the sketch depicting him seeking the blessings of Lord Buddha, during the PM's meeting with the Indian community in Lumbini. The crowd is heard chanting 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai (Long Live Mother India)'.

148.title: US has made Pakistan a slave without invading it: Ex-PM Imran Khan
148.article_body: The US has made Pakistan a slave without invading it, Pakistan's ousted Prime Minister Imran Khan has claimed. "The people of Pakistan will never accept the imported government," he added. Khan, who was voted out of power last month through a no-confidence motion, has repeatedly alleged that his ouster was plotted by the US with the help of local players.

149.title: It won't be a bad idea to get him in: Parthiv on playing Dhull vs PBKS
149.article_body: Ahead of DC-PBKS in IPL 2022, Parthiv Patel said it won't be a bad idea to include 19-year-old Yash Dhull in DC's squad for their must-win match. He added that Dhull's mindset will be very positive and fresh as he has scored runs in Under-19 World Cup and Ranji Trophy. Both DC and PBKS have six wins each so far.

150.title: 'Liger' is a full-on masala film, it will make people really happy: Ananya
150.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday, speaking about her upcoming movie 'Liger', said that it is a "full-on masala film" and it will make people really happy. The film, scheduled to release in theatres on August 25, will also feature Vijay Deverakonda. Sharing her experience of working with Deverakonda, Ananya said, "Amazing...We had a lot of fun when we were shooting in USA."

151.title: Irrfan was perfect picture of Lord Shiva at Babil's birth: Sutapa Sikdar
151.article_body: Late actor Irrfan Khan's wife Sutapa Sikdar recently shared a series of throwback pictures of Babil on Instagram as he turned 24. In a picture, Irrfan is seen holding baby Babil. Alongside the post, Sutapa wrote, "The smile on Irrfan's face when he first saw you couldn't be recreated in a performance by Irrfan himself...Irrfan was...perfect picture of Lord Shiva."

152.title: Mumbai civic body plans dedicated areas for feeding stray dogs
152.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is planning to create dedicated areas for feeding stray dogs. "The designated places will help reduce conflict between people who feed dogs in open areas and other residents. The BMC will also speak with animal rights activists," said a BMC official. Finding dedicated areas may be difficult due to land constraint, some officials said.

153.title: Man stabs Delhi Jal Board worker over road rage, shot at by police
153.article_body: Police have arrested a man who allegedly stabbed a Delhi Jal Board (DJB) worker and threatened him with a pistol during a fight in Burari. Police said the victim was unloading construction material from his vehicle when the accused started fighting over space. The accused was arrested after police shot at him and overpowered him.

154.title: Banks to approach RBI to change definition of 'fraud': Report
154.article_body: Several banks will approach the Reserve Bank of India asking to change the definition of the word "fraud", according to a report. At present, all banks need to label a borrowing company as 'fraud account' if it has been marked by one lender. As per bankers, this often leads to legalities even after the amount is repaid by the borrower.

155.title: Shilpa Shetty reveals first look as superwoman Avni for 'Nikamma'
155.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty on Monday shared her first look in a superhero avatar as Avni for her upcoming film 'Nikamma' on social media. Her sister, actress Shamita Shetty commented on her post, writing, "Hotness personified!" Shilpa had earlier shared a blank picture with the caption, "Soooo bored of the monotony...going off social media till I find a new avatar."

156.title: US to hold first public hearing on UFOs since the 1960s tomorrow
156.article_body: A US Congress panel will on Tuesday (May 17) conduct a public hearing on reports of Unidentified Flying Objects (UFOs) for the first time since the 1960s. Lawmaker Andre Carson, who will oversee the hearing, said, "Someone has to do it...We all watch television, we've heard...(and) read things. We want to see the footage and have it explained to us."

157.title: We have been very impressed with Wriddhiman Saha: Gary Kirsten
157.article_body: GT batting coach Gary Kirsten has said it's great to have Wriddhiman Saha in their team in the ongoing IPL season. "We've been very impressed [with Saha]...He understands his game and plays really well in the powerplay," added Kirsten. So far, the 37-year-old has scored 281 runs in eight games. He scored 67* off 57 to help GT defeat CSK.

158.title: Dadagiri, gundagardi not okay: Kejriwal to MCD over demolition drive
158.article_body: Criticising the BJP-led MCD for its anti-encroachment drive in Delhi, CM Arvind Kejriwal said that doing dadagiri, gundagardi is not okay and added that he's told party members to stand by the people. Their plan is to break all unauthorised colonies in Delhi, where 50 lakh people stay and to destroy jhuggis, where 10 lakh people are living, he said.

159.title: Nigerian man wanders in semi-undressed state in B'luru; arrested
159.article_body: A 33-year-old Nigerian man who is a resident of Bengaluru's Hennur Cross was arrested after he was found wandering in a semi-undressed state, police said on Monday. The local people had informed the police after they reportedly got irked by the man's behaviour. The man had also allegedly assaulted police officers after they arrived at the spot and questioned him.

160.title: Pune's maximum temperature may rise to 40°C in next few days
160.article_body: The maximum temperature in Pune may rise to 40°C in the next few days, but not higher than that, an India Meteorological Department (IMD) official has said. He said that in the next few days, westerly winds will be getting stronger and cloudy weather will stay. The day temperature at Shivajinagar was 37.6°C on Sunday.

161.title: Rakhi Sawant receives BMW worth ₹40 lakh as gift, shares video
161.article_body: Rakhi Sawant received a BMW X1 worth ₹40 lakh as a gift from boyfriend Adil Khan Durrani and his sister hair and skin specialist Shelly Lather in April. She confirmed dating Adil in an interview with a journalist and shared it on Instagram. She had earlier said, "I'm not Salman Khan to be able to afford such a luxury car."

162.title: Ex-MLA, family members booked for conspiring to kill UP MLA
162.article_body: Former MLA Vijay Mishra, his wife, daughter and three others have been booked for allegedly conspiring to kill Vipul Dubey, the sitting legislator from UP's Gyanpur. Mishra, who won Gyanpur seat four times, lost to Dubey in the recently concluded Assembly polls. An FIR was registered after a video surfaced in which some people were heard plotting to kill Dubey.

163.title: Congress does not want to suppress tribals' history: Rahul Gandhi
163.article_body: The relationship between Congress and the tribals is very old and deep, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said in Rajasthan's Banswara. "We protect your history. We don't want to erase or suppress your history," Gandhi added while addressing a public rally. "During the UPA government, we had brought a historic law to protect your land, forest and water," Gandhi stated.

164.title: 80% Delhi illegal, will it all be destroyed?: Delhi CM on demolition drives
164.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday, while reacting to BJP-ruled civic bodies' anti-encroachment drives, said over 80% of the city can be considered built on encroached land. "Will 80% of Delhi be destroyed?" he asked. "We want to assure people that we will provide a solution to encroachment. We will regularise unauthorised colonies...We'll ensure they have proper sanitation," Kejriwal added.

165.title: I left Mumbai because of parents; felt like a stranger in the crowd: Lucky Ali
165.article_body: Singer Lucky Ali said he wanted to leave Mumbai after his father, actor Mehmood's demise and felt like he didn't belong there. He added that despite knowing a lot of people, he felt like a "stranger in the crowd". Lucky said the responsibilities of his parents took him to Bengaluru. "Mumbai is my maika...I'm Mumbai's Mai ka lal!" he added.

166.title: 2 UP men pose as share brokers, cheat Chandigarh firm of ₹3.66 cr
166.article_body: Two men from Ghaziabad, UP, have been booked for cheating a Manimajra-based firm, in Chandigarh, of ₹3.66 crore. The complainant, director of the firm in Manimajra, said he had met the accused in 2019 and they claimed to be SEBI registered share brokers. The complainant said that he had given the accused ₹3.66 crore to purchase shares.

167.title: Momoa criticised for pics in Vatican chapel, apologises & says 'I took permission'
167.article_body: 'Aquaman' actor Jason Momoa has apologised after being criticised for posing inside the Vatican City's Sistine Chapel and posting the pictures and videos on Instagram. Users had pointed out that photography is banned in the sacred space. "I was very respectful...I asked for permission for what I thought would be okay," said Momoa. He, however, didn't remove the pictures.

168.title: Steve Jobs wanted original iPhone to have no SIM card: iPod's creator
168.article_body: Apple's iPod creator Tony Fadell revealed that Apple Co-founder Steve Jobs wanted the first iPhone with no SIM card slot and wanted it to work on CDMA networks. "We don't want another hole in it (iPhone)," Jobs was quoted as saying by Fadell. "We had to give him data...to tell him that we need a SIM card slot," added Fadell.

169.title: Disappointed with my performance: Chahal on his bowling against LSG
169.article_body: Rajasthan Royals spinner Yuzvendra Chahal has said that he is a "little bit disappointed" with his bowling performance against the Lucknow Super Giants on Sunday. "I was a little bit disappointed with myself...The leg-side was shorter...So I didn't want to give any extra runs. That's why I tried to bowl a little bit quicker tonight," Chahal said.

170.title: Ex-BJP MLC BJ Puttaswamy appointed head seer of mutt in B'luru
170.article_body: Former BJP MLC BJ Puttaswamy has been appointed the head seer of the newly inaugurated Thaileswara Ganigara Mahasamsthana Mutt in Bengaluru. Former Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa and BJP National General Secretary CT Ravi were among those present at the ceremony. Earlier this month, Puttaswamy had announced that he has taken 'sanyas'.

171.title: Heart issues, mountain sickness kill 39 since start of Char Dham Yatra
171.article_body: At least 39 people have died en route since the commencement of Char Dham Yatra in Uttarakhand, an official said on Monday. The official added that cardiac issues, high blood pressure and mountain sickness have been leading causes of death. Reports said that medically unfit people have been advised to not undertake the Yatra.

172.title: RBI may hike interest rates to pre-pandemic levels by Aug: SBI Research
172.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) will inevitably hike interest rates in the upcoming monetary policy meetings and may take the rates up to pre-pandemic levels of 5.15% by August, according to a report by SBI Research. The report added that the rate hikes will be a result of biting inflation caused by the Russia-Ukraine war.

173.title: Andrew Symonds' sister leaves note on cricketer's accident site as tribute
173.article_body: Late Australia cricketer Andrew Symonds' sister Louise left a note on the cricketer's accident site as a tribute. "Gone far too soon! Rest in peace Andrew. I wish we had one more day, one more phone call. My heart is broken. I will always love you my brother," the note read. Symonds passed away in a car accident on Saturday.

174.title: Emergence of Shivling in Gyanvapi Mosque a 'pauranik' message: UP Dy CM
174.article_body: Soon after claims of a Shivling being found in Varanasi's Gyanvapi Mosque complex were reported, UP Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya took to Twitter to hail the incident. "The emergence of 'Baba Mahadev' [Lord Shiva] in Gyanvapi on the occasion of Buddha Purnima is a 'pauranik' [from ancient Hindu scriptures] message for the 'Sanatan' Hindu tradition," he said.

175.title: Union Minister Sitharaman visits Kalena Agrahara lake in Bengaluru
175.article_body: Union Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Sunday visited Bengaluru's Kalena Agrahara lake, which was restored at a cost of ₹3 crore. The Bengaluru civic body has desilted the 7.3-acre lake and constructed a sewage diversion drain. A walkway and benches have also been set up for visitors and its storage capacity has been increased from 37.389 ML to 58.50 ML.

176.title: LIC shares trade at a discount in grey market ahead of listing: Reports
176.article_body: The shares of LIC were trading at a discount of ₹19 in the grey market on Monday, according to multiple reports. The ₹20,557 crore IPO of the state-run insurer, with the price band fixed at ₹902-949 per share, was oversubscribed nearly three times its issue size. The LIC shares will be listed on the stock exchanges on May 17.

177.title: Gang of 10 hacks panchayat chief to death in front of family in TN
