177.article_body: A case was filed after a gang of 10 people allegedly hacked a panchayat president to death in front of his family in Tamil Nadu's Chennai on Sunday. The incident apparently occurred after a lorry, in which the accused were travelling, collided with the victim's car. The accused had reportedly beaten the man after he came out of the car.

178.title: Raghu Dixit to perform at Cannes, says 'Maybe we'll make French sing in Kannada'
178.article_body: Singer-songwriter Raghu Dixit will be performing at the upcoming 75th edition of the Cannes Film Festival. The singer said that he wants the crowd to have a great time and forget all their worries during his one-hour performance on May 21. "I want everyone to have a good time...Maybe we'll make the French sing in Kannada with us," said Raghu.

179.title: Kangana visits Tirupati Balaji temple ahead of Dhaakad release; shares pics
179.article_body: Actress Kangana recently visited Tirupati Balaji temple in Andhra Pradesh on the occasion of Buddha Purnima ahead of her film Dhaakad's release. Taking to Instagram, she shared pictures of her visit and wrote, "Today on this auspicious [Buddha] Purnima...'Dhaakad' producer, @deepakmukut ji, his wife...along with few more team members sought darshan at Tirupati Balaji."

180.title: Shang-Chi's Simu does bhangra on stage with Tesher, singer shares video
180.article_body: Canadian singer Hitesh Sharma, professionally known as Tesher, has shared a video where he and 'Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings' actor Simu Liu can be seen doing bhangra on stage at Juno Awards in Toronto. They danced to 'Jalebi Baby', a Punjabi-English song produced by Tesher. "Now that's how we celebrate...Asian heritage," Simu said after doing bhangra.

181.title: BJP's civic bodies will run bulldozers on properties of 63 lakh people: Delhi CM
181.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that BJP-ruled civic bodies will run bulldozers on the shops and houses of 63 lakh people in the capital. "This will be the biggest destruction in Independent India," he added. Further, Kejriwal asked to conduct elections for the civic bodies and added that the new MCD should decide on the encroachment issues.

182.title: Paytm to not acquire Raheja QBE; to apply for new general insurance license
182.article_body: Paytm's parent company One97 Communications has said that its proposed acquisition of Raheja QBE General Insurance Company Limited has been called off. It cited the reason, "As the share sale and purchase transaction hasn't...consummated within the time period envisaged by the parties under the...agreement." The company said it intended to apply for a new general insurance license.

183.title: Seal area where Shivling found in Gyanvapi Mosque: Varanasi court
183.article_body: A Varanasi court has ordered the District Magistrate to seal the area of the Gyanvapi Mosque where a Shivling has reportedly been found after its survey. The court prohibited the entry of any person to the area and added that the DM, Police Commissioner, Police Commissionerate and CRPF Commandant Varanasi will be responsible for the security of the sealed area.

184.title: I love Salman Khan, he was 1st to know when I had babies: Krushna
184.article_body: Comedian Krushna Abhishek said that he loves actor Salman Khan. "I love his heart. He wanted me to have kids. He would tell me, 'Kashmera, Krushna you should have babies now.' When I had babies, he was the first one to know," he added. Krushna also said that his sons were conceived on the 13th day after his father's death.

185.title: Charles Leclerc crashes Niki Lauda's 1974 £1-million Ferrari F1 car, video surfaces
185.article_body: Ferrari F1 team driver Charles Leclerc crashed three-time world champion Niki Lauda's 1974 £1-million Ferrari F1 car at the Historic Grand Prix of Monaco, which features some of motorsport’s most iconic vehicles. Leclerc lost control of the vehicle following a brake failure and crashed into a wall. Leclerc had also suffered a crash in Monaco during last year's qualifying race.

186.title: This is a do-or-die match for us: DC's Kuldeep Yadav on match vs PBKS
186.article_body: Ahead of their match against PBKS on Monday, DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav said they've prepared well for the game and will try not to repeat the mistakes they've committed so far in the ongoing IPL season. "This is a do-or-die situation for us," he added. Both DC and PBKS have 12 points from 12 games so far in the tournament.

187.title: China recalls its teachers from Pakistan after Karachi blast
187.article_body: China has reportedly recalled its teachers from Pakistan following the suicide blast in Karachi in which four people, including three Chinese, were killed. The Chinese teachers posted at the Confucius Institute of the University of Karachi left the country. The institutes will continue to run, for which help from Pakistani teachers has been sought.

188.title: Kim Jong-un criticises COVID-19 response as death toll rises to 50
188.article_body: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un on Sunday criticised officials for their "irresponsible work attitude" and lack of organisation over their response to the coronavirus outbreak, state-media KCNA reported. This comes as the number of deaths in the country rose to 50 amid the outbreak. Kim also ordered the military to help stabilise the drug supply in Pyongyang, the report said.

189.title: PM Modi, Nepal PM Deuba lay foundation stone of Buddhist Centre in Lumbini
189.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi along with his Nepalese counterpart Sher Bahadur Deuba on Monday laid the foundation stone for the construction of the India International Centre for Buddhist Culture and Heritage in the Lumbini Monastic Zone. The Centre will be constructed by the International Buddhist Confederation (IBC), New Delhi, on a plot allocated by the Lumbini Development Trust (LDT).

190.title: 2 killed at flea market in 3rd shooting incident in 2 days in US
190.article_body: Two people were killed and three others hospitalised after a shooting incident at a flea market in US' Texas on Sunday. All five were involved in an "altercation" that led to the shooting, a police official said. This is the third shooting incident reported in two days after 11 people were killed in separate incidents in California and New York.

191.title: I don't think people understand the emotions of a working mother: Anushka
191.article_body: Speaking about her life as a mother, actress Anushka Sharma said striking a work-life balance is "certainly harder" for women. She said, "I don't think people understand the life and emotions of a working mother because the world is...male-dominated." "Heck, I'm a woman, even I didn’t understand...till I became a mother. Today, I've so much more respect...for women," she added.

192.title: Ex-eBay workers plead guilty to harassing couple with spiders, funeral wreaths
192.article_body: As many as six former employees at eBay have pleaded guilty to harassing a couple, who ran an online newsletter and published several articles critiquing eBay in the US. They sent them live cockroaches, spiders, funeral wreaths, a bloodied pig mask and pornography. The six of them were charged in June 2020 while former CEO Devin Wenig was also sued.

193.title: Wriddhiman has been a real catalyst in GT's comfortable wins: Vettori
193.article_body: Ex-NZ captain Daniel Vettori has said Wriddhiman Saha has been a catalyst in GT's "comfortable wins" in IPL 2022. "Wriddhiman has [scored] enough runs in the powerplay to not put too much pressure on [other batters]...He's been a real catalyst...in going from just winning games to winning them comfortably," explained Vettori. GT defeated CSK by seven wickets on Sunday.

194.title: Ukraine says it destroyed 11 Russian aerial assets, stopped troops
194.article_body: The Ukrainian Air Force claimed that it destroyed 11 Russian aerial assets including two cruise missiles, two helicopters and seven unmanned aerial vehicles. It further claimed to have prevented the Russian troops from crossing the Inhulets river, according to a report. Earlier, the Ukraine military had prevented the Russian troops from crossing the Siverskyi Donets river in the Donetsk region.

195.title: Riots instigated by that party which benefits from it: Ashok Gehlot
195.article_body: Referring to the recent communal clashes across India including Rajasthan, State CM Ashok Gehlot has said that "riots are instigated by the party that benefits from it". "Is Congress benefitting from the riots? Everyone knows that wherever riots happen, the Congress will face the backlash," CM Gehlot said. He further demanded a probe by the Centre on the nationwide clashes.

196.title: Leaders of Bharatiya Kisan Union form separate 'apolitical' outfit
196.article_body: A section of the Bharatiya Kisan Union, which led the 13-month-long farmers' protest against the farm laws, formed a separate outfit on Sunday known as BKU (Apolitical). Announcing the new outfit on the death anniversary of BKU founder Chaudhary Mahendra Singh Tikait, the leaders of BKU (Apolitical) alleged they were upset with "political" statements made by BKU spokesperson Rakesh Tikait.

197.title: 81-year-old man arrested for 'digital rape' of 17-year-old girl for over 7 years in Noida
197.article_body: An 81-year-old man has been arrested in Noida for 'digital rape' of minor for over seven years. The man was living with the 17-year-old rape survivor as her guardian, police said. 'Digital rape' means forced sex using any object other than the reproductive organ. The incident came to light after the survivor shared her plight with a mutual contact.

198.title: Had turban styling expert, 50,000+ costumes were handmade: Prithviraj director
198.article_body: 'Prithviraj' director, Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi, said that 500 different turbans were created for the film and over 50,000 costumes were handmade by a costume designer who was flown from Rajasthan to Mumbai. "We had an expert on turban styling on the set who would oversee the process of these turbans being worn by our actors," he added.

199.title: 3 men pose as bank executives, cheat Ludhiana resident of ₹1 lakh
199.article_body: Three men, who posed as bank executives, were booked for cheating a Ludhiana resident of ₹1 lakh. The victim in his complaint said, "They (accused) asked me to download a mobile app and also took my credit and debit card details. Later, they withdrew ₹1 lakh from my account." The complainant took the bank's customer care number from the internet.

200.title: Ratna, Fatima, Dia & Sanjana to star in Taapsee's production 'Dhak Dhak'
200.article_body: Taapsee Pannu's production company Outsiders Films has collaborated with Viacom18 Studios for the film 'Dhak Dhak', which will feature Ratna Pathak Shah, Fatima Sana Shaikh, Dia Mirza and Sanjana Sanghi. Directed by Tarun Dudeja, it'll revolve around four women's life-changing journey to the highest motorable pass in the world. "I'm sure this ride will be an enriching one," Taapsee said.

201.title: India's final destiny is welfare of world: RSS leader Krishna Gopal
201.article_body: The welfare of the world is India's final destiny, RSS leader Krishna Gopal said. "We do not need anything lesser than this...Our thought and behaviour are inclusive. We are incomplete without everyone," Gopal added. The leader described Hindutva as "an epitome of global unity" while adding that it "does not divide humanity".

202.title: Bull hit after it comes in front of speeding motorcycle in UP, couple dies
202.article_body: A 35-year-old man and his 32-year-old wife were killed after the motorcycle they were travelling on hit a stray bull in Uttar Pradesh. Police said that the incident took place when the bull suddenly came in front of the speeding vehicle. The couple was rushed to community health centre where the doctors declared the two dead.

203.title: 117 people saved from suicide by Hyderabad's Lake Police in 2022
203.article_body: The officials of Hyderabad's Lake Police Station have rescued and counselled 117 people from attempting suicide since January 2022. According to the officials, most people were saved with the help of 220 cameras installed on the 9-km-long road across the lake. Notably, police officials roam in civil dress as well to prevent suicide near the Tank Bund, police said.

204.title: It was a challenging role for Kartik: Rajpal on 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'
204.article_body: Rajpal Yadav, who'll be seen sharing screen space with Kartik Aaryan in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2', said that Kartik's performance in the film will touch the hearts of people. "It was a challenging role for Kartik but...he has done a fantastic job," he added. Rajpal further said Kartik's performance in the climax is one of the major highlights of the film.

205.title: Dhoni needs to take Gaikwad under his wing: Shaun Pollock
205.article_body: Ex-SA captain Shaun Pollock has said CSK will have to look for a captain outside their camp if MS Dhoni decides not to play in the next season. He added, "If [CSK management] goes to Ruturaj Gaikwad [for captaincy], you have to give Dhoni another year, and [Dhoni needs to] really take him under his wing."

206.title: Kashmiri Pandit employees to be posted at safer places: J&K L-G after Rahul Bhat's killing
206.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha has said that security would be increased in the residential areas of the government Kashmiri Pandit employees in the Valley. He added, "Posting for all of them would be done at safer places in the coming seven days (district centres and tehsil centres)." This comes after terrorists killed Rahul Bhat in his office.

207.title: Unbelievable: Leone as her fans organise blood donation drive on her b'day
207.article_body: Sunny Leone took to Instagram to thank her fans for organising a blood donation camp on her 41st birthday. She shared a picture of a news article, which mentioned that her fans in a Karnataka village "cut a cake, distributed food and conducted a camp that collected 39 units of blood" on her birthday. "This is unbelievable...I'll also...donate...blood," Leone wrote.

208.title: Karnataka govt's portal for online mango sales starts from today
208.article_body: The Karnataka government will start selling mangoes online through its own web portal for this year's mango season from today. The portal was launched in 2020 by the Karnataka State Mango Development and Marketing Corporation Limited in collaboration with the India Post. Notably, Karnataka cultivates the mango crop on 1.68 lakh hectares spread across 16 districts including Bengaluru Rural.

209.title: B'luru police tracks over 2,500 IP addresses to arrest man who stole a car via OLX ad
209.article_body: The Bengaluru police arrested a man three months after he allegedly stole an SUV on the pretext of taking it for a test drive. He stole the SUV on January 30, from an engineer who had posted an ad about it on OLX. While the accused used a stolen phone, the police tracked him after verifying over 2,500 IP addresses.

210.title: Will charge a bomb if I've to wear dhoti & walk in old Baburao style: Paresh
210.article_body: Speaking about what's actually needed to bring him on board if he has to play the role of 'Baburao' again in 'Hera Pheri' sequel, Paresh Rawal said, "If I've to wear...dhoti and walk in the same way with glasses...I'll charge a bomb!" "There's no excitement left in me for any of my characters unless it's put in...different backdrop," he added.

211.title: Thoughts of Lord Buddha can make our planet more harmonious: PM
211.article_body: On the occasion of Buddha Purnima, PM Narendra Modi on Monday said thoughts of Lord Buddha can make our planet more peaceful, harmonious and sustainable. "On Buddha Purnima, we recall the principles of Lord Buddha and reiterate our commitment to fulfil them," PM tweeted. PM Modi will be visiting Lumbini in Nepal on the occasion of Buddha Purnima on Monday.

212.title: 15-yr-old Pune girl waiting to cross road with aunt hit by a truck, dies
212.article_body: A 15-year-old girl was killed after she was hit by a truck while she was standing at a traffic signal to cross a road in Pune. The incident happened when the deceased girl was on way to her relative's place along with her aunt and cousin. Police said that the driver stopped the truck after hearing screams of people.

213.title: Full lunar eclipse creates rare super blood Moon in parts of world, pics surface
213.article_body: The first lunar eclipse of the year was visible from several countries in Americas, Europe and Africa. The eclipse coincided with a super Moon, which's when the Moon is at its closest point to Earth in its orbit. It created a super blood Moon as the Earth's natural satellite took on a reddish colour due to the Rayleigh scattering effect.

214.title: We will overcome, that's our determination: Sonia Gandhi
214.article_body: The Congress party will overcome, party chief Sonia Gandhi said in her concluding remarks at the 'chintan shivir' on Sunday. "We will overcome. That is our determination," Gandhi added. "Congress will have a new 'uday' (rising). That is our 'Nav Sankalp'," Gandhi stated. Gandhi also announced that the party will launch a 'National Kanniyakumari to Kashmir Bharat Jodo Yatra'.

215.title: Hate remains a stain on America's soul: Biden on Buffalo shooting
215.article_body: A day after 10 people were killed in New York's Buffalo shooting, US President Joe Biden said, "We must all work together to address the hate that remains a stain on the soul of America." Biden was speaking at the US Capitol in Washington at a memorial event for policemen killed in the line of duty.

216.title: PM Modi lands in Nepal, offers prayers at Maya Devi Temple with Nepal PM Deuba
216.article_body: PM Narendra Modi landed in Nepal on Monday and was received by Nepal PM Sher Bahadur Deuba on his arrival in Lumbini. PM Modi visited the Maya Devi Temple in Lumbini, where he and Nepal PM Deuba offered prayers. PM Modi tweeted, "Happy to be among the wonderful people of Nepal on the special occasion of Buddha Purnima."

217.title: Putin is 'very ill with blood cancer', Russian oligarch recorded saying: Report
217.article_body: An unnamed Russian oligarch was recorded saying that country’s President Vladimir Putin is "very ill with blood cancer". In a recording obtained by a US magazine New Lines, the unnamed oligarch was heard discussing Putin's health with a Western venture capitalist. The businessman also said that Putin underwent a surgery shortly before he ordered the invasion of Ukraine.

218.title: Ukrainians flood village on purpose to stop Russia's attack on capital Kyiv; pics surface
218.article_body: Ukrainian forces opened a dam early in the war in Demydiv, a small village north of Kyiv, causing the Irpin River to flood the village and thousands of acres around it. It created a quagmire and submerged cellars and fields but prevented a Russian attack on the capital. Two months later, people are still using inflatable boats to move around.

219.title: 4 NCP workers booked for slapping BJP leader at his Pune office
219.article_body: Pune police have registered a non-cognisable offence against four NCP workers for allegedly slapping BJP leader Vinayak Ambekar at his office in the city over a post against the former's party chief Sharad Pawar. This comes after a video of the incident had surfaced online. Ambekar had earlier filed a complaint claiming that about 20 NCP workers had attacked him.

220.title: You spend more time drinking coffee & eating cheese: UK PM on work from home
220.article_body: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson in an interview said that working from home doesn’t work. Johnson said, "My experience of working from home is you spend an awful lot of time making another cup of coffee and then...walking very slowly to the fridge, hacking off a small piece of cheese...and then forgetting what...you were doing."

221.title: Hasaranga is like a brother, happy if he takes wickets: Chahal on purple cap
221.article_body: Talking about the competition for the IPL 2022 purple cap, spinner Yuzvendra Chahal, who's currently the highest wicket-taker, said he's happy with the success of other bowlers. "I'm happy for Wanindu Hasaranga because he's like a brother to me. If he takes wickets, if Kuldeep Yadav takes wickets, I'm happy with that," he stated. Hasaranga is currently the second-highest wicket-taker.

222.title: Hassan Sheikh Mohamud elected as new President of Somalia
222.article_body: Hassan Sheikh Mohamud has been elected as the new President of Somalia after defeating the incumbent Mohamed Abdullahi Mohamed in a runoff. Mohamud bagged 214 votes in the runoff, while his rival Mohamed was limited to 110. Mohamud was sworn in immediately after the result. This would be his second five-year term after his initial stint from 2012 to 2017.

223.title: Which bowlers have taken first-ball wicket on their IPL debut?
223.article_body: CSK's 19-year-old fast bowler Matheesha Pathirana on Sunday became the ninth bowler to take first-ball wicket on his IPL debut. Ishant Sharma was the first bowler to achieve the feat in IPL after he dismissed Rahul Dravid, while playing for KKR against RCB. In 2009, three bowlers managed to take a first-ball wicket on their IPL debut.

224.title: Been playing for 15 years, this setup at GT is really good: Wriddhiman Saha
224.article_body: GT opener Wriddhiman Saha, who was named 'Man of the Match' for his performance against CSK, said he sees himself as an aggressive player in the powerplay and the franchise is also letting him play freely. "I've been playing for 15 years now, but this setup...is really good," he added. GT are at the top of the IPL points table.

225.title: I look up to my father-in-law; he's very humble & grounded: Anup on Raj Babbar
225.article_body: Speaking about his father-in-law Raj Babbar, actor Anup Soni said, "I look up to him because he also came from a...humble background and reached great heights. He's still very humble and grounded." "I always maintain...he's the only actor from the National School of Drama who played a commercial hero. We...have brilliant actors...but Raj Babbar did it all," Anup said.

226.title: Wasn't a good idea to bat first: Dhoni after 7-wicket loss to GT
226.article_body: After losing to the Gujarat Titans by seven wickets, CSK skipper MS Dhoni has admitted that it wasn't a "good idea" to bat first in the match. "The fast bowler's ball wasn't coming on. That's why the batsmen found it tough...In the second half, it got slightly better...More runs in the middle overs would have been good," Dhoni said.

227.title: We screamed for help for 1.5 hrs, no one heard: Mundka fire survivor
227.article_body: One of the survivors of the Mundka fire incident, Shazia Parveen, said that she and other people trapped inside the building kept screaming for help for one-and-a-half hours but nobody heard them. "We also tried to break the glass to reach the terrace...but were unable to do so," Shazia said, adding that they weren't allowed to use phones at work.

228.title: Delhi Metro commuters using smart cards more than pre-COVID days
228.article_body: There has been a significant rise in the share of Delhi Metro commuters using smart cards this year as compared to pre-COVID days, according to DMRC. Since January 2022, about 78% of the commuters are using smart cards, up from around 70% before the pandemic. Notably, DMRC had temporarily stopped the token system when it resumed services in 2020.

229.title: World's most valuable company Saudi Aramco's profits surge by over 80% in Q1
229.article_body: Saudi Aramco has said that its profits jumped by more than 80% in the first three months of the year. The first-quarter earnings of the firm showed a record net income of $39.5 billion, up from $21.7 billion during the same period last year. Notably, Saudi Aramco overtook Apple as the world’s most valuable company last week.

230.title: Group stone pelts people swimming in H'yana canal, 5 feared drowned
230.article_body: Five people are feared drowned after an alleged rival group pelted stones at around 9-10 people who were swimming in the Yamuna canal in Haryana's Yamunanagar on Sunday, police said. "Out of fear, people went deeper and...people who didn't know how to swim, drowned," DSP (Yamunanagar-1) Subhash Chand said. The two groups had an enmity from 2020, he added.

231.title: Abdullah family engineered Kashmiri pandits' destruction: BJP leader
231.article_body: BJP's Tarun Chugh said National Conference chief Farooq Abdullah is trying to play dual politics after "destroying" the Hindus in J&K. Chugh in an official statement said the Abdullah family engineered the "destruction" of Kashmiri pandits' families in J&K for its political gains. "Abdullahji, shedding crocodile tears in the name of Kashmiri pandits is of no use," Chugh stated.

232.title: Man attacks woman lawyer in Karnataka, kicks and slaps her in public; video surfaces
232.article_body: A woman lawyer was kicked and slapped repeatedly by her neighbour in Bagalkote district of Karnataka on Saturday. A video of the incident showing the man attacking the lawyer in public and no one coming to her rescue has gone viral on social media. According to police, he attacked the lawyer due to personal enmity regarding a civil dispute case.

233.title: Influencer raises ₹1.8 cr for Uber driver who helped her after she was robbed in US
233.article_body: A social media influencer raised over $2,40,000 (approximately ₹1.8 crore) via crowdfunding for an Uber driver after he helped her when she got robbed in California. The driver had helped her find her phone and credit card which were robbed during Coachella. The driver had revealed to her that his daughter was diagnosed with cancer, following which she started crowdfunding.

234.title: Speaking on movie more important for PM than Kashmiri Pandits genocide: Rahul
234.article_body: Senior Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has alleged that "it is more important for the Prime Minister to speak on a film than on the genocide of Kashmiri Pandits". "Terror is at its peak in Kashmir today due to the policies of BJP. Prime Minister, take the responsibility of security and try to bring peace," Gandhi tweeted.

235.title: Devotees rush to get coconut prasad at MP event, 17 injured in stampede
235.article_body: A stampede took place at a religious event in Madhya Pradesh's Bina when devotees rushed to receive the coconut prasad that was being distributed. Seventeen people were injured during the incident that took place at Bageshwar Dham temple at Khimlasa Road. An official said that there were around 25,000 people at the event when the incident took place.

236.title: Mundka fire victims' families give DNA samples to identify bodies
236.article_body: The family members of 24 of the 27 victims who died in Delhi's Mundka fire submitted their DNA samples to help identify the charred bodies found on the site, said police. The samples, submitted at Sanjay Gandhi Memorial Hospital, will be studied by forensic experts. The bodies of eight victims have been identified so far.

237.title: Folk singer Yogesh Gadhvi uses casteist slur at public event in Guj, booked
237.article_body: Police have booked folk and devotional singer Yogesh Gadhvi, also known as Yogesh Boxa, for allegedly using casteist slur against the Dalit community during his performance at a public event in Gujarat. Reports said that Yogesh was performing at the inauguration ceremony of a girl students' hostel in Radhakrishna Nagar. BJP state President CR Paatil was also present at event.

238.title: Centre not consulting states on national policies: Maharashtra Minister
238.article_body: Maharashtra Minister Subhash Desai has accused the Centre of not consulting states "while drafting new policies of national significance". "It must hear the views of the states. The dialogue that is needed between the two is not happening," Desai said. "If you take our views, we are not going to mislead you. We may protect our state's interest," he added.

239.title: Andrew Symonds' dogs survived car accident, one didn't leave his side: Eyewitness
239.article_body: Andrew Symonds' two blue heeler dogs survived the car accident which took the former Australia all-rounder's life. "One of them was very sensitive and didn't want to leave him. It would just growl at [us] every time we tried to move him or go near him," an eyewitness said. The forensic crash unit is investigating the accident.

240.title: Jet fuel prices hiked by 5% to climb new record high in Delhi
240.article_body: Prices of aviation turbine fuel (ATF) have been hiked by 5% to reach a record-high of ₹1,23,039.71 per kilolitre (₹123.03 per litre) in Delhi, as per a price notification of state-owned fuel retailers. Jet fuel makes up 40% of the running cost of an airline and ATF prices have been hiked every fortnight since the beginning of 2022.

241.title: Vicky Kaushal's father shares throwback pic on son's 34th birthday
241.article_body: Vicky Kaushal's father, action director Sham Kaushal, took to Instagram on Monday to wish the actor on his 34th birthday. He shared a collage featuring Vicky's childhood picture, and wrote, "Wish you a very Happy Birthday Puttar. Always love and blessings...Feeling blessed and proud to have a son like you." Vicky's brother Sunny Kaushal also wished him on his birthday.

242.title: Matheesha Pathirana is an excellent death bowler: MS Dhoni
242.article_body: Praising 19-year-old Sri Lankan bowler Matheesha Pathirana, who made his debut for CSK against GT on Sunday, captain MS Dhoni said, "He is an excellent death bowler." Dhoni added, "A bit similar to Malinga...With a slingy action, Pathirana doesn't get a lot of bounce. He has got that slower one as well." Pathirana registered figures of 3.1-0-24-2 on debut.

243.title: Will legally reclaim all temples demolished by Mughals: Eshwarappa
243.article_body: BJP leader KS Eshwarappa on Sunday said all the temples demolished by Mughals should be reclaimed "legally". "In this country, 36,000 temples have been demolished by the Mughals from those times itself," Eshwarappa added. "Everyday news is coming out. Through the courts, without a fight or struggle, on the basis of the verdict, we will reclaim these temples," he stated.

244.title: Rahul to contest 2024 polls, he will rule the country: DK Shivakumar
244.article_body: Karnataka Congress leader DK Shivakumar said that Congress leader Rahul Gandhi will contest the 2024 Lok Sabha elections and he will "rule the country". "We all are confident that Congress will come back under Rahul Gandhi's leadership...G23 has gone, the entire party is united and we all are one (on G23 push for the parliamentary board)," Shivakumar added.

245.title: India reports 2,202 new COVID-19 cases, 27 deaths in last 24 hours
245.article_body: India has reported 2,202 COVID-19 cases, 2,550 recoveries and 27 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,487 COVID-19 cases and 13 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 17,317, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,241.

246.title: IAF rescues 119 train passengers stranded in Assam due to heavy rain
246.article_body: The Indian Air Force helicopters rescued 119 passengers from Assam's Ditokchera railway station. While sharing pictures on social media, the Indian Air Force said that the train had been stranded at the railway station for over 24 hours due to incessant rains. Earlier, three people had lost their lives as rains had triggered landslides in parts of Dima Hasao district.

247.title: Moneylender extorts Pune couple despite getting repaid; 3 arrested
247.article_body: Three persons were arrested in connection with an extortion case in which a moneylender allegedly forced a Pune couple to pay him even after the loan was repaid. The complainant said they had borrowed ₹2 lakh and repaid around ₹12.24 lakh at 40% interest but the moneylender still forced them to sign property papers and grabbed their flat.

248.title: Up to 90% of our team will permanently work from home: Zerodha CEO
248.article_body: Zerodha's CEO Nithin Kamath has said that 85-90% of his employees will permanently work from home. "People are enjoying living in their small towns. Belagavi has amazing talent and we have a large team working there. Folks are enjoying Belagavi...having maids and independent houses which they could never think of affording in Bengaluru," he said.

249.title: Met actors who show off; I manage with them: Panchayat 2 actor Raghubir
249.article_body: When asked how's it working with the new generation of actors, 'Panchayat' season 2 actor Raghubir Yadav said, "I never treat them as new actors because the work that we take up is new to us. I learn...from them. I try to become young with them." "I've met many actors who show off. I manage with such actors," he added.

250.title: Motivational speaker called to address employees among dead in Mundka fire
250.article_body: A 62-year-old motivational speaker, Kailash Jyani, who was called to address the employees of a commercial unit in Mundka was among those who died in the fire that broke out at a building near the Mundka metro station. His 37-year-old son who was accompanying him to venue also died in the incident. Fire broke out in building on May 13.

251.title: Sewage flows into Bengaluru's Haralur Lake, dead fish seen: Report
251.article_body: The condition of Bengaluru's Haralur Lake is deteriorating due to constant flow of sewage, following which dead fish were also seen in the waterbody last week, The Indian Express reported. "Death of fish is an indicator that...water quality isn't conducive," a lake conservationist said. The sewage flow is because BWSSB is "yet to lay...sanitary pipelines", a BBMP superintendent engineer claimed.

252.title: 4 Pune pub owners booked over operating past midnight, serving hookah
252.article_body: Pune police have booked the owners and managers of three pubs and bars for allegedly operating past midnight and one another for serving hookah to customers. During a raid on the pub serving hookah, the police also seized hookah pots, flavoured tobacco material and phones worth a total of about ₹89,600. Serving hookah was banned in Maharashtra in 2018.

253.title: Another mass shooting in US, 1 killed, 5 injured in California church attack
253.article_body: One person was killed, four were critically wounded and another person sustained minor injuries after a man opened fire at a California church. The gunman was "hogtied" by parishioners after the incident. The suspect, an Asian man in his 60s, was detained and two handguns were recovered. This comes after an 18-year-old man shot dead 10 people in New York.

254.title: SBI hikes lending rate by 10 bps; 2nd such hike in 2 months
254.article_body: State Bank of India has hiked the marginal cost of funds-based lending rate (MCLR) by 10 basis points, or 0.1%, across tenures with effect from May 15. Notably, this is SBI's second hike in MCLR in two months. An increase in MCLR will lead to a rise in EMIs for those who have availed home, vehicle and personal loans.

255.title: Once again the batting group wasn't able to perform collectively: Rahul
255.article_body: After their second straight defeat in the ongoing IPL season, LSG captain KL Rahul said, "Once again the batting group [wasn't] able to perform collectively." He added, "We have lost three-four games in the powerplay as a batting unit." Chasing RR's 178-run total, LSG scored 154/8 in 20 overs and suffered their fifth defeat in 13 games.

256.title: Fraudsters using fake UPI payment screenshots to cheat in Pune
256.article_body: Several cases of cheating by fraudsters who show fake UPI payment screenshots to cheat businessmen have been reported in Pune. The cyber crime police station recorded as many as 379 cheating complaints related to UPI-based platforms between January and April. In many instances, jewellers were cheated of large sums of money by frauds using fake payment screenshots.

257.title: Trolls call Amitabh Bachchan 'buddhe', accuse him of drinking desi liquor; he responds
257.article_body: A section of Facebook users trolled Amitabh Bachchan for his post on Sunday, wherein he wished his followers Good Morning at 11.26 am. A troll commented, "Abbey Buddhe, dopahar ho gayi hai," to which Amitabh wrote, "I pray to god...nobody insults you when you grow old." Another accused him of drinking desi liquor, with Amitabh responding that he doesn't drink.

258.title: How does the IPL 2022 points table read with just 7 matches remaining?
258.article_body: With just seven matches remaining in IPL 2022 league stage, GT are the only team to have qualified for playoffs. They're assured of a top-two finish. Following their win against LSG, RR are now second on the table, followed by LSG. RCB (14 points), DC (12), KKR (12), PBKS (12) and SRH (10) are also in contention for playoffs spots.

259.title: He was someone I could call at 2:30 am and say 'Let's meet': Harbhajan on Symonds
259.article_body: Talking about his late MI teammate Andrew Symonds, Harbhajan Singh said, "We used to sit together, have a drink, laugh, share a lot of stories." He added, "He was someone I could call at 2:30 in the morning and say 'Hey mate, what are you doing? What are you up to? Let's meet' and he'd be up for it."

260.title: 10-yr-old Hyd boy enters swimming pool without safety tube, drowns
260.article_body: A 10-year-old boy drowned to death after he entered a swimming pool without safety tube in Hyderabad. The boy's aunt said that the management of the swimming pool did not have safety tubes. "There was no one...when he was drowning. We started shouting when we saw Manoj in the pool. The management people came after 10 minutes," his aunt added.

261.title: Adani to become India's 2nd biggest cement maker with $10.5 bn Holcim deal
261.article_body: Adani Group on Sunday acquired Holcim's stake in Ambuja Cements and ACC in a $10.5 billion deal, making it the second-biggest cement producer in India. Ambuja and ACC have a combined capacity to produce at least 70 million tonnes of cement annually, second to UltraTech Cement's  120 million tonnes capacity. This will also be the largest-ever acquisition for Adani Group.

262.title: RR defeat LSG by 24 runs, move to 2nd position on IPL 2022 points table
262.article_body: RR defeated LSG by 24 runs at Brabourne Stadium in Mumbai to move to the second position on the IPL 2022 points table. RR and LSG have 16 points each, with RR having a superior net run-rate (NRR). RR put up a total of 178/6 with Yashasvi Jaiswal top-scoring with 41(29). LSG were restricted to 154/8 in their 20 overs.

263.title: NATO expects Turkey not to oppose membership of Finland, Sweden
263.article_body: NATO and the US on Sunday said that they expect Turkey not to oppose the membership of Finland and Sweden into the Western military alliance. Notably, Turkey had said that it had reservations about Finnish and Swedish membership. Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan had claimed that the Nordic countries were home to many "terrorist organisations".

264.title: Sweden to apply for NATO membership amid Ukraine war, ruling party confirms
264.article_body: Sweden's ruling Social Democrats party on Sunday said it will work toward the country applying for membership in the military alliance NATO. This came after Finland said it will seek membership in the alliance amid the Russia-Ukraine war. The party, however, said it was opposed to stationing nuclear weapons or permanent NATO military bases in Sweden.

265.title: Symonds' demise is big loss to cricketing fraternity as a whole: Lalchand
265.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Lalchand Rajput has said former Australia all-rounder Andrew Symonds' demise is a "big loss" not only to Australian cricket but the cricketing fraternity as a whole. "If you look at his career, he was a versatile player...adopted all the formats...he was a match-winner," he added. Symonds passed away, aged 46, in a car accident.

266.title: UN report lists US, Pakistan among 23 drought-hit countries
266.article_body: Pakistan is among the 23 countries that have faced drought emergencies over the past two years, according to a UN report. Iran, Iraq, the US and Afghanistan are among the 22 other countries also facing a similar situation. Separately, the report estimated that an additional 4 million square kilometres of natural areas would require drought restoration measures by 2050.

267.title: Good move: Musk on Netflix telling staff 'If you don't like our content, you can quit'
267.article_body: Elon Musk tweeted, "Good move by Netflix", in response to an article about Netflix asking its employees to quit if they don't like the company's content. Netflix recently updated its culture guidelines to add an "Artistic Expression" section. Under it, Netflix says, "If you'd find it hard to support our content breadth...Netflix may not be the best place for you."

268.title: Probably GT weren't given enough credit after their first few games: Vettori
268.article_body: Discussing table-toppers GT's performance in ongoing IPL, Daniel Vettori said the debutants weren't given enough credit after their first few matches as they were close and could have gone either way. "But someone like Rahul Tewatia, David Miller or Rashid Khan got them over the line," he added. GT are the first team to qualify for the playoffs.

269.title: 3 more cases against Ketaki for allegedly insulting Sharad Pawar on Facebook
269.article_body: Three more cases have been registered against Marathi actress Ketaki Chitale for allegedly sharing a 'derogatory' Facebook post on NCP chief Sharad Pawar. Two of the fresh cases were registered in Mumbai and one in the Akola district of Maharashtra. She was arrested by Thane Crime Branch on Saturday and a court remanded her in police custody till May 18.

270.title: Can't walk on road even for a few secs: 10-yr-old activist Licypriya as Delhi hits 49°C
270.article_body: As maximum temperatures in Delhi crossed 49 degrees Celsius on Sunday, 10-year-old climate activist Licypriya Kangujam said, "Temperatures are [higher] on the ground than (in) the air." She said, "When I go out shopping in the afternoon, I can't walk for even a few seconds on the road...It's difficult to breathe the air. Very dangerous for kids."

271.title: Sedition law, UAPA abused in last 7 yrs to finish opponents: Raut
271.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Sunday said that the sedition law, prevention of Money Laundering Act and Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act have been abused widely in the last seven years "to finish political opponents". The PMLA will go the same way as sedition law, which has been stayed by the Supreme Court, added Raut.

272.title: VP Naidu visits UAE to offer condolences over death of Sheikh Khalifa
272.article_body: Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu on Sunday arrived in the UAE to offer his condolences following the demise of the country's late ruler Sheikh Khalifa Bin Zayed Al Nahyan. Naidu offered his condolences to new President Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan and UAE's entire leadership. Several leaders from across the world are visiting the country to pay their respects.

273.title: Novak Djokovic wins Italian Open, clinches his record-extending 38th Masters 1000 title
273.article_body: Novak Djokovic defeated Stefanos Tsitsipas 6-0, 7-6(7-5) in the final of the Italian Open on Sunday to clinch a record-extending 38th ATP Masters 1000 title. It is Djokovic's first title victory of the year. The Serbian had become the fifth man in the Open Era to earn 1,000 singles match wins when he defeated Casper Ruud in the semi-finals.

274.title: 50-yr-old grocery store owner killed by 3 with sticks over ₹30 in UP
274.article_body: Three people allegedly thrashed a 50-year-old grocery store owner to death for demanding ₹30, which they had borrowed from him, police said on Sunday. The incident took place on Saturday night when the accused attacked the shopkeeper Yashpal, with sticks for demanding  ₹30, which he had lent them earlier, Additional Superintendent of Police (Rural) Ram Arj said.

275.title: Rebels killed 7,000 civilians in Ethiopia's Amhara in 2021: Govt
275.article_body: Nearly 7,000 civilians were killed by the Tigrayan rebels in Ethiopia's Amhara region between June and December last year, according to a report commissioned by the regional government. The study also documents that several mass graves were found at sites throughout the region. However, the rebels have rejected the findings of the report.

276.title: Adani to buy Holcim's stake in Ambuja Cements and ACC for $10.5 billion
276.article_body: Adani Group on Sunday announced that it will acquire Holcim's stake in Ambuja Cements and ACC. The value for Holcim's stake and open offer consideration is about $10.5 billion. It will be the largest-ever acquisition for Adani Group and the largest-ever transaction in India's infrastructure and materials space. Switzerland-based Holcim holds 63.19% stake in Ambuja Cements and 54.53% in ACC.

277.title: He sat there like an a**hole: Wanda on Will slapping Chris at Oscars
277.article_body: Actress-comedienne Wanda Sykes has spoken about the 2022 Oscars slap incident, saying she is "still traumatised". Actor Will Smith slapped comedian Chris Rock onstage after the latter made a joke about his wife Jada Pinkett Smith. Wanda added, "I couldn't believe [Will] was still sitting there, like an a**hole. Shouldn't you be sitting there with a lawyer or LAPD, motherf*cker?"

278.title: Kochi Police deny permission to use loudspeakers at Bob Marley event
278.article_body: Fort Kochi Police denied permission to use loudspeakers for a cultural programme commemorating singer Bob Marley citing law and order issues. Programme convenor Rasheed Mattanchery said that the permission for the programme was denied by the police and they plan to go ahead with the event with 'necessary changes' to the programme titled 'Bob Marley-Songs and Strife'.

279.title: Bride injured as mass wedding stage collapses due to wind in Maha
279.article_body: A mass wedding pandal, where 125 couples were to tie the knot, collapsed due to gusty winds in Maharastra's Palghar on Sunday, injuring a bride and three others. People started running out of the pandal and it led to a commotion. The injured persons were given first aid and the event was later shifted to an adjacent pandal.

280.title: Director Avinash booked for sharing pic of Amit Shah with arrested IAS officer
280.article_body: 'Anaarkali of Aarah' director Avinash Das has been booked for allegedly sharing a picture of Union Home Minister Amit Shah with IAS officer Pooja Singhal. The Jharkhand IAS officer was arrested in a money laundering case. A case was filed against Das by Ahmedabad Police who said he allegedly tried to "mislead the people and defame the reputation of Shah".

281.title: Ajay Devgn-starrer 'Raid' to be remade in Telugu: Report
281.article_body: Ajay Devgn's 2018 film 'Raid' will reportedly be remade in Telugu. Harish Shankar will reportedly direct the film. "Harish Shankar recently visited Mumbai to lock a few things related to...Telugu version," a source was quoted by Pinkvilla. "The makers are currently looking out for the lead actor who can fill in Ajay's shoes in the Telugu version," the source added.

282.title: India's 1st-ever Thomas Cup win is a great achievement: Srikanth's father
282.article_body: Shuttler Kidambi Srikanth's father Krishna lauded the Indian badminton team following their first-ever Thomas Cup title win in Bangkok, saying it's a great achievement for all the Indians. "It's a very happy moment that India has achieved...Thomas Cup after such a long period," he added. Notably, Srikanth remained undefeated throughout the tournament. India beat Indonesia 3-0 in final on Sunday.

283.title: Rajamouli's 'RRR' to re-release in US on June 1 for one-night event
283.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli's 'RRR' starring Ram Charan and Jr NTR will be re-releasing in US for a one-night event. Rajamouli said, "America has embraced 'RRR' as its own and crossing borders, the love that the American audience has shown our film has been gratifying." 'RRR' is the second-highest grossing Indian film in US after Rajamouli's Prabhas-starrer 'Baahubali 2: The Conclusion'.

284.title: Raghav Juyal joins cast of Salman Khan's 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali'
284.article_body: Dancer and actor Raghav Juyal will be a part of Salman Khan's upcoming film 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali'. "I'm playing a pivotal role along with Pooja Hegde, Aayush Sharma and Zaheer Iqbal which is directed by Farhad Samji," Raghav said in a statement. Reportedly, the film also features former Bigg Boss contestant Shehnaaz Gill.

285.title: Behind every successful man there's a woman, we should have a Wife's Day: Athawale
285.article_body: Ramdas Athawale, MoS for Social Justice and Empowerment, on Sunday demanded that a "Wife's Day" be celebrated along the lines of Mother's Day. "Behind every successful man, there's a woman...We should celebrate Wife's Day," Athawale said. "A mother gives birth while a wife stands by her husband in good and bad times," he added.

286.title: Sadly this isn't the 1st such case: India condemns killing of 2 Sikhs in Pak
286.article_body: India on Sunday condemned the killing of two Sikh businessmen in Pakistan's Peshawar and called upon the concerned authorities to take "strict action against those responsible for this deplorable incident". The Ministry of External Affairs said, "Sadly, this is not the first such case or a rare occurrence...We have registered our strong protest with the Government of Pakistan."

287.title: IIFA postponed following UAE President’s demise, to be held in July
287.article_body: International Indian Film Academy 2022 (IIFA) has been postponed following UAE President Sheikh Khalifa Bin Zayed Al Nahyan's demise. The event was slated to be held in May, but now will be held from July 14 to July 16 due to the 40-day mourning period in the UAE. IIFA will be hosted by Salman Khan, Ritesh Deshmukh and Maniesh Paul.

288.title: AR Rahman's debut film 'Le Musk' to premiere at Cannes Film Festival
288.article_body: Music composer AR Rahman's debut directorial venture 'Le Musk' will be premiering at the Cannes Film Market's Cannes XR programme. "'Le Musk' has been several years in the making with collaborators worldwide. We've aimed to create an unprecedented, subtle sensory cinematic surrealism," Rahman said. He composed the film's background score and adapted it from a screenplay by Gurachi Phoenix.

289.title: India added 8.8 million jobs in April 2022: CMIE report
289.article_body: Indian labour markets saw substantially increased activity during April 2022 as the labour force increased by 8.8 million from 428.4 million in March to 437.2 million in April, according to a Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy (CMIE) report. "This is one of the largest monthly increases in the labour force if we exclude the lockdown impacted months," the report added.

290.title: Have decided to be in UK with family for few months & not work: Purab
290.article_body: Actor Purab Kohli said he is in London with his family after finishing the shoot of his upcoming project in Mumbai. Purab further added that he'll take a break from acting for a few months to be with his family. "I am very happy (taking a break). I'd like to spend a lot of time at home also," he added.

291.title: World no. 1 Swiatek defends Italian Open title with 28th straight win
291.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek defeated Madrid Open champion Ons Jabeur 6-2, 6-2 to successfully defend her Italian Open title on Sunday, clinching her fifth straight title. Swiatek, who didn't drop a set in Rome, extended her winning streak to 28 matches. Swiatek has won every WTA 1000 she has contested this season, winning Doha, Indian Wells and Miami before.

292.title: Ukraine has deployed American M-777 howitzers at front lines: US
292.article_body: The US embassy in Kyiv on Sunday tweeted that Ukraine has deployed many of the newly supplied American M-777 howitzers at the front lines. The howitzers were delivered as part of the "$800 million care package for the Ukrainian Armed Forces", it said. "All but one of the 90 Howitzers sent by the US are now in Ukraine," it added.

293.title: No joy for me apart from money: Paresh Rawal on 'Hera Pheri' sequel
293.article_body: Veteran actor Paresh Rawal, on being asked about doing a sequel of 'Hera Pheri' or 'Andaz Apna Apna', said that "other than money", it will have no joy for him. "If we are coming up with a sequel...with the same old ghisa-pita jokes, it will not work. It should evolve and only then I'll be excited about it," he added.

294.title: This win is precious: Lakshya's mother on India's maiden Thomas Cup win
294.article_body: Terming the Indian men's badminton team's first-ever Thomas Cup win "very precious", shuttler Lakshya Sen's mother Nirmala said, "We're feeling so happy and proud. We congratulate the entire Indian team." She added, "We were watching the match. We'll celebrate the win with Lakshya via video conference and cut the cake." India defeated 14-time champions Indonesia 3-0 in their maiden final.

295.title: Thousands take part in protests against President Saied in Tunisia
295.article_body: Thousands of people took to the streets in Tunisia on Sunday to protest against Tunisian President Kais Saied, demanding a return to the normal democratic order. The protesters chanted "The people want democracy" and "Saied has led the country to starvation" at the main rally in central Tunis. Saied had seized executive power and dismissed the Parliament last summer.

296.title: He was so beautiful it was inhuman: Jennifer on engagement with Depp
296.article_body: Johnny Depp's ex-fiancee Jennifer Grey recalled her nine-month engagement with the actor in the late 1980s. "You have to understand...1989 Johnny Depp, [was] so beautiful, you've never seen a more beautiful...it's almost inhuman," she stated. Earlier, Grey had said that she does not recognise Depp from the clips of the defamation trial against his ex-wife Amber Heard.

297.title: Earlier I felt bad people knew my character's name, not mine: Pankaj
297.article_body: Actor Pankaj Tripathi has revealed in an interview that he would earlier feel bad when people would recognise him by his characters' names and not his own. "I would always wish they knew my name. And today, everyone knows my name but they love my characters so much that they deliberately call me by those names," the actor added.

298.title: Sidharth Malhotra shares pic of injury from 'Indian Police Force' set
298.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra on Sunday shared a selfie with filmmaker Rohit Shetty which showed his injured forearm from the sets of 'Indian Police Force'. He wrote alongside the picture, "#RohitShetty action hero equals to real sweat, real blood! Rohit sir working the camera for some crazy action sequences in Goa." Rohit also shared a behind-the-scenes picture from the Goa shoot.

299.title: AAP announces alliance with Twenty20 Party in Kerala
299.article_body: AAP national convener and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday announced an alliance with Twenty20 Party in Kerala ahead of Thrikkakara bypoll. The alliance has been named People's Welfare Alliance (PWA). Kejriwal also announced free electricity to the people of the state if elected to power and said generator shops in Delhi have been shut due to round-the-clock power supply.

300.title: List of Indian cities with highest maximum temperatures today released
300.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has released a list of cities that recorded maximum temperatures of over 45 degrees Celsius amid a prevailing heatwave in parts of India. Cities in eight states namely Rajasthan, UP, MP, Punjab, Bihar, Haryana, Maharashtra (Vidarbha) and Jharkhand featured on the list. Delhi also featured on the list as temperatures there breached 47 degrees Celsius.

301.title: BJP turning demographic dividend into demographic disaster: Rahul
301.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Sunday said that the BJP is hell-bent on turning demographic dividend into a demographic disaster. "Congress has always provided a platform for people to deliberate without fear, worry," he said. "Meaningful conversations are not allowed in India nowadays. We see conversations being muzzled and we do not understand its consequences," he added.

302.title: Actress Pallavi Dey found dead at her flat in Kolkata, family alleges murder
302.article_body: Bengali TV actress Pallavi Dey was on Sunday found dead at her rented apartment in Kolkata's Garfa area, the police said. As per a preliminary investigation, the actress, who was in her 20s, is suspected to have died by suicide, police said. Her family, however, alleged that she may have been murdered. Her live-in boyfriend is being questioned.

303.title: Shabana pens note on Shyam Benegal's 'advertising acumen' at Cannes
303.article_body: Veteran actress Shabana Azmi on Saturday took to Instagram to share a picture of herself along with late actress Smita Patil and veteran director Shyam Benegal from Cannes 1976. They were there to promote 'Nishant'. She wrote, "We had no publicity material...Shyam...asked Smita...and me to...walk up and down the promenade to attract attention...That was the advertising acumen of #Shyam Benegal."

304.title: Asia's richest man Adani nears $10 bn deal for Holcim's India business: Report
304.article_body: Asia's richest man Gautam Adani is nearing a deal to buy Swiss building material company Holcim's India business, Bloomberg reported. Adani Group will pay $10 billion for 63.1% of Ambuja Cements Ltd, currently held by Holcim, along with its related assets. The deal is expected to make Adani Group a sizeable player in the cement sector, the report added.

305.title: Movie industry workers arrested by officials in Iran: Filmmaker
305.article_body: Mohammad Rasoulof, an award-winning Iranian filmmaker, said that Iranian security forces raided offices and homes of several filmmakers and other industry professionals and arrested some of them. In a statement signed by dozens of movie industry professionals, Rasoulof claimed that some film production equipment was confiscated. The statement condemned the raids and called them "illegal".

306.title: Groom in UP puts wedding on hold until cousin's release from jail
306.article_body: A groom in UP halted his wedding to save his cousin (Ankit), who was imprisoned after a fight with the bride's relatives during a pre-wedding ceremony. Didauli SHO Suneel Malik said that the bride's father filed a complaint against Ankit. "We are helpless as the legal procedure has to be followed before Ankit can be released," said the SHO.

307.title: India's Thomas Cup win is like winning cricket WC in 1983: Dinesh Khanna
307.article_body: Following Indian men's badminton team's maiden Thomas Cup win after defeating 14-time champions Indonesia 3-0 in final on Sunday, ex-Asian badminton champion Dinesh Khanna congratulated them, saying, "It's like winning...World Cup in cricket for the first time in 1983." He added, "There's nothing more greater than this win, as far as team championship for men in the sport is concerned."

308.title: Historic feat for Indian badminton: Kohli on India's maiden Thomas Cup win
308.article_body: Congratulating Indian men's badminton team after their first-ever Thomas Cup win, Virat Kohli took to Twitter and wrote, "A historic achievement and a massive moment for Indian badminton." Abhinav Bindra tweeted, "An incredible achievement by an incredible Team India...bounced back from tough situations on numerous occasions to win gold." India beat defending champions Indonesia 3-0 in final.

309.title: Sri Lanka probes Indian media report of potential LTTE attack
309.article_body: Sri Lanka on Sunday said that it has launched an investigation into the claim of an Indian media report of a potential LTTE attack. Citing Indian intelligence sources, The Hindu had reported that some erstwhile cadre had entered Tamil Nadu to plan and execute attacks in Sri Lanka. The country also said that it's taking further steps to strengthen security.

310.title: Apna time aa gaya: Mahindra on India's 1st-ever Thomas Cup win for badminton
310.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra on Sunday reacted to India's first-ever Thomas Cup win for badminton by saying, "This is the dawn of an era of Indian ascendancy in this sport." He said, "I grew up reading about the Thomas Cup and titans like Indonesia's Rudy Hartono who dominated it. Today we swept Indonesia away...Apna time aa gaya (our time has come)."

311.title: 3 passengers dead, 10 injured as bus hits truck on highway in Gujarat
311.article_body: A private bus carrying over 30 passengers crashed into a parked truck on the Ahmedabad-Palanpur highway in Gujarat on Sunday, killing three people and injuring 10 others. The deceased, who were in their thirties, were from Rajasthan. The injured persons have been admitted to a civil hospital in Palanpur.

312.title: What are stablecoins, the product that led to a massive selloff in crypto market?
312.article_body: Stablecoin is a utility token built upon another coin's blockchain to create a cryptocurrency that's non-volatile, by maintaining its value at $1. However, stablecoin TerraUSD/'UST' collapsed from $1 to as low as 13 cents this week. Terra's token LUNA, meant to stabilise UST prices, fell 100% to a fraction of a cent, causing a massive selloff in crypto market.

313.title: Rahul is going for the kill, learning well from LSG mentor Gambhir: Piyush
313.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Piyush Chawla has praised KL Rahul, saying he's leading IPL debutants LSG brilliantly in the ongoing tournament. He added that LSG captain is learning well from the team's mentor Gautam Gambhir, who helped KKR win two titles under his captaincy. "It's good to see him going for the kill," he further said. LSG are currently second in standings.

314.title: Bollywood star kids look weird like boiled eggs: Kangana Ranaut
314.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut, when asked why South films are doing better than Bollywood films nowadays, said, "The way [the South industry] has a connect with their audience, it's very strong." She added that connect lacks in Bollywood as star kids "go abroad to complete their studies...talk in English...watch only Hollywood films." "They even look weird like boiled eggs," she added.

315.title: Delhi maximum temperature crosses 49 degrees amid heatwave warnings
315.article_body: Maximum temperatures breached the 49 degrees Celsius mark at two weather observatories in Delhi on Sunday, amid warnings of an intense heatwave in the national capital. Mungeshpur and Najafgarh observatories recorded 49.2 degrees Celsius and 49.1 degrees Celsius respectively. Gurugram, meanwhile, recorded a maximum temperature of 48.1 degrees Celsius. IMD has issued an orange alert for Delhi.

316.title: GT defeat CSK, become first team to win 10 matches in IPL 2022
316.article_body: GT defeated CSK by seven wickets in their IPL 2022 clash on Sunday. With the win, GT became the first team to win 10 matches in IPL 2022. GT are on top of the table with 20 points. They have been assured of a top-two finish on the points table. Wriddhiman Saha top-scored for GT with 67*(57).

317.title: RR to bat first against LSG in their IPL 2022 clash, playing XIs announced
317.article_body: RR captain Sanju Samson won the toss and elected to bat first in their IPL 2022 clash against LSG. RR have made two changes to their playing XI, with Jimmy Neesham and Obed McCoy replacing Rassie van der Dussen and Kuldeep Sen, respectively. Meanwhile, Ravi Bishnoi has replaced Karan Sharma in LSG's playing XI.

318.title: India will have no farmers in next 25 years: Sadhguru
318.article_body: Sadhguru has said that in another 25 years, India won't have any farmers because of the education system, which makes it mandatory for students to attend school till they are 18. He added that "out of the 63% of the farmers' population, not even 2% of farmers want their children to become the same".

319.title: Mumbai businessman's body recovered from creek in Thane
319.article_body: The body of a Mumbai-based businessman was recovered from a creek in Thane on Sunday morning, the police said. Some passers-by had alerted the police after spotting the body of 54-year-old Prashant Tukaram Vichare. As of now, the police have registered a case of accidental death and further investigation is on, an official said.

320.title: 11-yr-old boy cries before Bihar CM & says 'I want good education'; video viral
320.article_body: A video showing an 11-year-old class 6 student crying before Bihar CM Nitish Kumar and seeking his help to get a quality education has gone viral. Sonu Kumar told the CM, "Whatever my father earns he squanders on liquor", adding that he wants to be IAS/IPS if the government helped him. The CM has reportedly instructed officials to help him.

321.title: Great learning: David Hussey on Rahane batting vs SRH despite injury
321.article_body: KKR mentor David Hussey praised batter Ajinkya Rahane for batting against SunRisers Hyderabad despite his injury. In a video posted by KKR's Twitter handle, David said, "Great learning for everybody, if you are injured, don't come back, just start swinging out there and try to get as many as possible." Rahane scored 24-ball 28 runs against SRH.

322.title: NHRC seeks report from Delhi govt over Mundka fire that killed 27
322.article_body: The National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) on Sunday expressed serious concern over the fire incident at a four-storey building in Mundka that claimed 27 lives. It has asked the Delhi government to submit an action taken report to the commission within two weeks. NHRC also asked its Director General to send a team immediately to conduct an on spot investigation.

323.title: Symonds was a lovely guy, incredible human being & a fighter: Nikhil
323.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Nikhil Chopra said that late cricketer Andrew Symonds was a "lovely guy, full of life, helpful, and incredible human being." Recalling Symonds' playing days, Nikhil called the Australian a "fighter". "On many occasions, the team is on the verge of losing, he did a turnaround for them, which shows his mental toughness, and was a fighter," he said.

324.title: Putin's forces won't have a chance: 22-yr-old Olympic shooter defending Ukraine
324.article_body: Ukraine's 22-year-old shooter Kristina Dmitrenko, who won the gold medal in the 2016 Youth Olympic Games biathlon, is serving her nation with the National Guard of Ukraine amid the Russia-Ukraine war. She warned Russian President Vladimir Putin's forces that they won't have a chance, while adding, "I shoot well." "I'll stand to the end...victory will surely be ours," she added.

325.title: Such an electrifying personality: Pietersen on GT pacer Rashid Khan
325.article_body: Praising Rashid Khan, ex-England captain Kevin Pietersen said the GT pacer is an "electrifying personality", adding he's one of the "cool dudes" in the ongoing IPL. "He delivers whenever the captain looks at him. He's just in the feel in this season," he added. The 23-year-old has taken 16 wickets from 13 matches so far.

326.title: Man caught & beaten for raping 2 minor sisters in Gurugram
326.article_body: Two young sisters, both below five years of age, were allegedly raped by a 25-year-old man in Gurugram, police said on Saturday. The accused took the girls to his house on the pretext of giving them candy, police said. The girls' mother, however, caught him in the act, following which he was beaten before being handed over to the police.

327.title: Shuttler Chirag Shetty's shirtless celebration during Thomas Cup final goes viral
327.article_body: Indian shuttler Chirag Shetty's shirtless celebration during Thomas Cup final against Indonesia has gone viral. Shetty was seen removing his shirt and throwing it towards the crowd after winning his doubles match. India defeated Indonesia 3-0 in the final to win Thomas Cup for the first time in their history.

328.title: UP Police demoralised: Akhilesh criticises CM Yogi for DGP removal
328.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav criticised Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath for removing DGP Mukul Goel for inaction and said that the police force is demoralised. He also termed Adityanath's reasons for removing Goel as "childish". "Was his eligibility not checked at the time of his appointment? So those who selected him were also guilty," Yadav tweeted.

329.title: Pimpri-Chinchwad wards' boundaries final, no more changes now: PCMC
329.article_body: The Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation's election office said that there will be no more changes to the ward demarcation even if citizens make any suggestions or take objections. The demarcation was published on the PCMC website two days ago. The delimitation plan includes approval to changes in boundaries of Charholi, Bhosari, Chikhali, Indrayani Nagar and Premlok Park panels or wards.

330.title: Delhi CM to meet AAP MLAs tomorrow over anti-encroachment drives
330.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal will chair a meeting with all the MLAs of the Aam Aadmi Party on the ongoing anti-encroachment drives in Delhi on Monday. The meeting was scheduled to take place on May 14, but it was cancelled after a massive fire broke out in Mundka. The civic bodies have been carrying out anti-encroachment drives in multiple areas.

331.title: Man gets 1-yr rigorous imprisonment for flashing girl in Mumbai
331.article_body: A taxi driver was sentenced to one year of rigorous imprisonment by a special POCSO court for flashing his private parts at a 15-year-old female passenger at Mumbai's Charni Road in 2016. Notably, the man had claimed that he was being falsely implicated in the case over a dispute over the fare. However, the court rejected the man's claim.

332.title: I'm more than a rat in a rat race: Anushka on stepping away from her production house
332.article_body: Talking about stepping away from her production house, Anushka Sharma said, "My industry is all about...'run, run, run'...It's a rat race...you simply have to be part of it. But I'm more than a rat in a rat race." She added, "I want to enjoy...life...I never want to give [acting] up...That's why I had to make a sacrifice."

333.title: Finland will apply to join NATO ending decades of neutrality amid Russia-Ukraine war
333.article_body: Finland will apply to join the 30-member military alliance NATO amid the Russia-Ukraine war, the country's leaders announced on Sunday. This marks a historic shift in Finland's policy of neutrality that it adopted during the Cold War. Finnish President Sauli Niinisto called Russian President Vladimir Putin yesterday to tell him about the same and was told it would hurt ties.

334.title: If Roy shook your hand, you had his word: Ricky Ponting on Andrew Symonds
334.article_body: Condoling former Australia all-rounder Andrew Symonds' demise, ex-Australia captain Ricky Ponting tweeted, "If Roy shook your hand, you had his word, that's the sort of bloke he was and that's why I always wanted him on my team." Ponting added, "An extraordinary player and even better human being. Can't believe he's gone. Thoughts are with his family at this time."

335.title: Govt extends wheat procurement season till May 31, 2022
335.article_body: The government on Sunday announced that the wheat procurement season has been extended till May 31, 2022. "Present geopolitical situation and market prices may also affect the projected procurement of wheat during the current Rabi marketing season 2022-23 under the central pool," a government order said. Union Minister Piyush Goyal said it will "ensure that no wheat farmer faces inconvenience".

336.title: Mr Coach, you made us proud: Taapsee to boyfriend after India's Thomas Cup win
336.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu praised her boyfriend-coach Mathias Boe after the Indian men's badminton team created history by winning the Thomas Cup for the first time ever. Pannu took to her Instagram Stories and wrote, "Mr Coach, you made us proud," for Mathias Boe, India men's badminton team doubles coach. "What a performance, what a team," Boe wrote on Instagram.

337.title: ₹1 cr reward announced for men's badminton team for historic Thomas Cup win
337.article_body: Sports Minister Anurag Thakur has said that a ₹1 crore cash reward will be given to the Indian men's badminton team to acknowledge their historic Thomas Cup win. "This extraordinary feat, with successive victories over Malaysia, Denmark and Indonesia, calls for matching honour by the nation," said Thakur. PM Narendra Modi also congratulated the team.

338.title: World no. 8 Berrettini withdraws from 2022 French Open
338.article_body: World number eight Matteo Berrettini has pulled out from the French Open, beginning May 22, as he continues his recovery from a right hand injury, the Italian announced on Instagram on Saturday. "My hand is feeling great and I am working hard to build up my match fitness," he added. Berrettini had the surgery in March.

339.title: AC local train services to be increased to 32 in Mumbai from Monday
339.article_body: The number of air-conditioned local train services will be increased from 20 to 32 in the Mumbai suburban section from Monday onwards. The decision has been taken to meet the demands of the passengers travelling by AC locals, officials said. "Out of the additional 12 services being introduced, six services each will be in up and down directions," officials said.

340.title: Gang that arranged fake witnesses for bail busted in Faridabad
340.article_body: Faridabad Police on Saturday claimed to have busted a gang, headed by an advocate, that arranged fake witnesses for obtaining bail, but the advocate is yet to be arrested, they added. "The advocate used to produce fake witnesses after arranging fake personal IDs depending on the facts of bail matters," said DCP (crime) Faridabad Narender Kadiyan.

341.title: N Korea reports 8 lakh COVID-19 cases within 3 days of reporting 1st outbreak
341.article_body: North Korea on Sunday said it has 8,20,620 COVID-19 cases, three days after announcing the first cases of the infection on May 12. A total of 42 people have died of COVID-19 in North Korea, while 3,24,550 others are under medical treatment, state media KCNA said. The country is taking "swift state emergency measures" to control the epidemic, KCNA said.

342.title: Pooja awarded by PETA, 1st Indian director not to use animals in films
342.article_body: Actress-filmmaker Pooja Bhatt on Sunday took to Twitter to share a letter from PETA which awarded her PETA India's Compassionate Film Production Company Award. She has become the first Indian director to pledge not to use animals in her films. Pooja tweeted, "Will rely on computer graphics if a film/show of mine ever has an animal written into it."

343.title: I've been feeling bad since his exit: Sehwag on CSK's Jadeja
343.article_body: Talking about Ravindra Jadeja, Virender Sehwag said he's been feeling bad since CSK all-rounder's exit from the remainder of IPL 2022 due to a rib injury. Jadeja, who had captained the team in the first eight matches, played a total of 10 matches before being ruled out of the tournament. The 33-year-old hit 116 runs and took five wickets.

344.title: Told Thiago, 'I'd have signed you 4 yrs ago': Klopp after FA Cup win
344.article_body: After Liverpool won the FA Cup after beating Chelsea, Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp said he had a conversation with Thiago Alcantara. "After the game, I said to Thiago, 'If I'd known what a player you are, I would have signed you four years earlier'," he joked. "Obviously, he could already play football...well, but he learned running at Liverpool," he added.

345.title: Andrew Symonds was a personality in Australian cricket: Madan Lal
345.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Madan Lal said he's "very sad" after hearing the news of Andrew Symonds' death. "Symonds was a personality in Australian cricket. Whatever cricket he played he played with a lot of passion," he added. "It is very sad, first Rodney Marsh then Shane Warne and now Andrew Symonds. I can only say rest in peace," he further said.

346.title: NCB seizes weed worth ₹1.5 cr at Foreign Post Office in Mumbai
346.article_body: Hydroponic weed valued at ₹1.5 crore was seized by the Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) during two separate operations at the Foreign Post Office (FPO) in South Mumbai, an official said on Saturday. Around 1.7 kilograms of weed was seized during the operations. The operations were conducted on the basis of specific inputs that the drug was couriered from the US.

347.title: Man dies after coming in contact with illegally drawn live wire in B'luru
347.article_body: A 30-year-old man died after coming into contact with live wire that was illegally drawn to an advertisement hoarding near Hebbal police station bus stand in Bengaluru on Saturday. Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Ltd (BESCOM) officials said incident occurred after victim touched the metal portion of a bus shelter. Victim's body was shifted to B R Ambedkar Medical College Hospital.

348.title: Cong to launch 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' from Kashmir to Kanyakumari on Oct 2
348.article_body: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi during the party's Chintan Shivir in Rajasthan's Udaipur on Sunday announced that the party will launch a 'National Kanyakumari to Kashmir Bharat Jodo Yatra' from Gandhi Jayanti this year. "All of us young and all will be joining the 'Yatra'," she added. Around 400 leaders are attending the Chintan Shivir.

349.title: It's disrespectful when actors use phones on set: Actress Shubha Khote
349.article_body: Actress Shubha Khote, who is currently seen in 'Spy Bahu', said that she gets irked by actors who use phones on set. "I've heard a lot about some actors coming late, someone arguing, and all. Yes, there are actors who are on their phones," she added. "And I think that's disrespectful. I never take my mobile on sets," she said.

350.title: Sara gives a glimpse of her vacation in Kashmir; shares picture with jawans
350.article_body: Actress Sara Ali Khan gave a glimpse of her vacation in Kashmir. While sharing a series of photos on Instagram from Kashmir and thanking her travel guide, Sara wrote, "Best views, best treks, best sunsets and moon rises!" Sara also shared a photo of her dressed in casual winter wear, surrounded by jawans. She was accompanied by her two friends.

351.title: Uddhav discarded ideals of Balasaheb, acting on Sonia's orders: Ranas
351.article_body: Independent MP Navneet Rana and her MLA husband Ravi Rana accused Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray of discarding his father Balasaheb Thackeray's ideals. "Uddhav has discarded the ideals of Balasaheb and is now acting as per the directions of the 'Matoshree' of 10, Janpath," the Rana couple said referring the Congress President Sonia Gandhi as "Matoshree".

352.title: Cong criticises TRS move to build district office in Hyderabad's Banjara Hills
352.article_body: The Telangana unit of Congress has criticised the TRS government for allotting itself a plot at Hyderabad's Banjara Hills for constructing the party's district office.
