"TRS has land worth ₹150 crore in the city when the state government has no land to give to landless Dalits or for the creation of a tribal university," said Revanth Reddy, TPCC President.

353.title: Bus service from Delhi to Leh via Keylong resumes after 8 months
353.article_body: The bus services in Keylong in Lahaul and Spiti district to Leh in Ladakh resumed on Sunday after eight months. The resumption of the bus services will facilitate the travel for people from Delhi to Leh via Keylong. The Himachal Road Transport Corporation (HRTC) has announced ₹2,398 as the fare price for each passenger from Keylong to Delhi.

354.title: Hyd Police arrests 2 for stealing vehicles; seize stolen vehicles
354.article_body: Hyderabad Police arrested two people for allegedly stealing automobiles and seized the stolen vehicles, Karkhana Police informed on Saturday. Additional Deputy Commissioner of Police (north zone) G Venkateshwarlu said the two were taken into custody for travelling on bikes without proper documents. The accused confessed they stole vehicles under the limits of Hyderabad during verification.

355.title: 22-yr-old man poses as IAS officer, seeks security cover in Punjab; held
355.article_body: A 22-year-old man, who posed as an IAS officer and sought security cover to attend a karate tournament, was arrested in Ludhiana after getting caught by the police. On March 12, the accused sought security cover to attend the tournament, where he said he was invited as chief guest. However, he failed to produce an identity card on being asked.

356.title: Algae powers a microprocessor continuously for a year; pic released
356.article_body: University of Cambridge researchers used algae to power a microprocessor continuously for a year, and counting, using nothing but ambient light and water. The system contains a type of non-toxic algae 'Synechocystis' that harvests energy from the sun through photosynthesis. The tiny electrical current this generates then interacts with an aluminium electrode and is used to power a microprocessor.

357.title: Need to accept that Cong's connect with people was broken: Rahul
357.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Sunday said that the party needs to accept that its connection with the people was "broken down" and that this has to be "revived". Rahul made the remark while addressing the party's Chintan Shivir event in Rajasthan's Udaipur. He added that to do this, hard work is required as it "won't happen with any shortcut".

358.title: Congress approves one family, one ticket rule with conditions
358.article_body: Congress has given approval for reforms like enforcing one family, one ticket rule, 50% representation for those below 50 years of age and five-year term limit for those holding positions. However, one family, one ticket rule will have a condition that the relatives of leaders who aspire to contest polls should have worked for Congress for at least five years.

359.title: Choreographer Tushar Kalia, Triveni Barman get engaged; share pics
359.article_body: Choreographer Tushar Kalia and Indian Beauty Pageant titleholder Triveni Barman got engaged and shared pictures from the ceremony on social media on Sunday. Tushar wrote in his caption, "To new beginnings. Send us your love and blessings." Triveni shared the pictures, writing, "You're the best thing that ever happened to me." Filmmaker Karan Johar commented, "Badhaiyan!"

360.title: Civilian killed in gunfight between terrorists & forces in J&K
360.article_body: A civilian was killed in a gunfight between security forces and terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama on Sunday. Terrorists fired upon a patrol team of police and CRPF near a bridge that connects Litter in Pulwama and Turkwangam in Shopian. After the encounter, the terrorists managed to run away, police said.

361.title: Virat isn't a bowler, I turn to him for batting tips: Anushka on 'Chakda...'
361.article_body: Actress Anushka Sharma said she turns to husband and cricketer Virat Kohli for batting tips while preparing for her film 'Chakda 'Xpress'. "We definitely discuss my progress...Luckily, he's not a bowler so I listen to my coach more," Anushka said, adding, "I always appreciated how mentally pressurising it can be...to play cricket, but now...I also understand how...physically draining it is."

362.title: A lot of memes have been made on Chhote Pandit; feels great to see that: Rajpal
362.article_body: Speaking about his character 'Chhote Pandit' in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa', actor Rajpal Yadav said, "A lot of memes have...been made on 'Chhote Pandit'. It feels great to see that, from kids to older people, everyone enjoys watching my character." "I'm...blessed and grateful for the love and appreciation my character has received, not just in India but even globally," he added.

363.title: Pakistan PM orders immediate measures to fight Cholera outbreak
363.article_body: Days after a Cholera outbreak was reported in Balochistan's Dera Bugti, Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif ordered the federal and provincial governments to take measures on an emergency basis to control it. Sharif directed that the people must be provided clean water, food and medicines. This comes after the residents protested and claimed that over a dozen people had died.

364.title: Adanis not interested in politics: Adani Group on reports of Rajya Sabha nomination
364.article_body: Adani Group has issued a clarification denying reports that India's richest man Gautam Adani or his wife, Dr Priti Adani, might be nominated to Rajya Sabha. "These are blatantly false reports...Neither Mr Gautam Adani or Dr Priti Adani nor any member of the Adani family has interest in a political career or in joining any political group," the company said.

365.title: Kangana is sweet girl, I've seen her evolve as actor: Arjun Rampal
365.article_body: Actor Arjun Rampal has called his 'Dhaakad' co-star Kangana Ranaut "a sweet girl", adding that he has seen her evolve as an actor. The actor further said that the two got their first National Awards together when she received it for 'Fashion' and he got it for 'Rock On'. "She [came] to my nightclub...and we partied together," he added.

366.title: Sri Lanka lifts nationwide curfew for Buddhist festival
366.article_body: The Sri Lankan administration lifted the nationwide curfew on Sunday on the occasion of a major Buddhist festival, Vesak, which marks Buddha's birth, enlightenment and death. However, the government will not hold celebrations scheduled at the Kuragala temple amid the ongoing economic crisis. The Buddhists are free to celebrate, conduct mass meditation and sermons, said an official.

367.title: $11 trillion wiped out in worst losing streak for global stocks since 2008 crisis
367.article_body: As much as $11 trillion has been wiped out from the markets amid the worst losing streak for global stocks since the 2008 financial crisis, Bloomberg reported. The valuations of companies across the US and Europe have lowered due to the selloff in MSCI ACWI Index, MSCI's global equity index. Morgan Stanley and Citigroup strategists expect stocks to fall further.

368.title: I'm 'personally liable' for $750 mn SoftBank loan: Better.com's Vishal Garg
368.article_body: Better.com's CEO Vishal Garg admitted that he "personally guaranteed" $750 million cash infusion provided to the company last year and he's "personally liable" for it. In an email to employees, Garg wrote, "I'm fully committed with everything I own and will ever own." He said the "SoftBank $750 million loan comes due around my 50th birthday", five years from now.

369.title: I created a cave, ate red meat 3 times a day: Ranveer on playing 'Khilji'
369.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh said that while preparing for the role of Alauddin Khilji in the movie 'Padmaavat', he created cave-like space for himself. "I lived there...and breathed there," he said, adding that he used to eat red meat three times a day. "I was like...it should come straight from my gut. I thought it will affect my temperament," Ranveer said.

370.title: Ashish Nehra's street smart, knows what you need to succeed: Manjrekar
370.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar praised Gujarat Titans head coach Ashish Nehra and called the latter "street smart". "He's street smart, and knows what you need to succeed in cricket because his career has been like that," Manjrekar added. "If you become a friend to players...you keep them in a good mental space, then the team's performance changes," he added.

371.title: UK confirms 2 new monkeypox cases a week after reporting 1st case
371.article_body: UK's Health Security Agency (UKHSA) on Saturday confirmed two new monkeypox cases in England a week after the country reported its first case of the rare viral infection. It stated that the new cases are not linked to the previous case. "While investigations remain ongoing...it's important to emphasise [that the infection] doesn't spread easily," a UKHSA official said.

372.title: Entire nation is thrilled: PM congratulates men's badminton team on Thomas Cup win
372.article_body: After the Indian men's badminton team won the Thomas Cup for the first time ever, PM Narendra Modi congratulated the team saying, "The entire nation is elated." He added, "This win will motivate so many upcoming sportspersons." India created history by defeating 14-time champions Indonesia 3-0 on Sunday.

373.title: Hasaranga's 2/15 vs PBKS was equivalent to ton off 40 balls: Tendulkar
373.article_body: Praising RCB spinner Wanindu Hasaranga for his performance against PBKS, Sachin Tendulkar said conceding 15 runs in an innings where 209 were scored is equivalent to scoring a hundred off 40 balls. "Very impressed with the way Hasaranga bowled. He always seems to pick up wickets in crucial phases," added Sachin. Currently, Hasaranga has 23 wickets from 13 games.

374.title: Kuldeep Sen has been a terrific find for Rajasthan Royals: Vaughan
374.article_body: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan praised Rajasthan Royals fast bowler Kuldeep Sen and said, "Kuldeep has been a terrific find for Rajasthan." Vaughan also recalled Kuldeep's IPL debut against LSG where he defended 15 runs in the last over bowling to Marcus Stoinis. "He has got eight wickets [in seven IPL 2022 matches so far], bowls the key overs," Vaughan added.

375.title: Get jitters, can't sleep day before: Asees on nervousness before song releases
375.article_body: Singer Asees Kaur said that she gets the jitters and can't sleep a day before the release of her songs. "This nervousness will go on till my last song," she said, adding that when she entered the industry, she sang every song that was offered to her and that she is now cautious while choosing projects.

376.title: B'luru men withdraw cash after stealing senior citizen's ATM card; held
376.article_body: A gang of thieves was arrested in Bengaluru for withdrawing thousands of rupees from a senior citizen's ATM card as he had written its PIN on it. The man was walking on the roadside when the accused stole his wallet and mobile phone on May 11. Three men were arrested by police, while some of them managed to run away.

377.title: Akshay, Vidya iconic; didn't want to waste: 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' director
377.article_body: 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' director Anees Bazmee has stated that the characters portrayed by Akshay Kumar and Vidya Balan in the first film were larger than life and iconic. "I didn't want to waste them. I am sure when people will watch the film, they will support my decision," the director added. 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' features Kartik Aaryan and Kiara Advani.

378.title: Here are some more: Ira to trolls who criticised her for wearing bikini on b'day
378.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan's daughter, Ira Khan, reacted to trolls who criticised her for wearing a bikini as she celebrated her birthday with her family and friends. Taking to Instagram on Saturday, Ira shared new pictures with her friends and her boyfriend Nupur Shikhare, and wrote, "If everyone is done hating and trolling my last birthday photo dump...here are some more!"

379.title: Coup to remove Putin is underway in Russia: Ukrainian military spy chief
379.article_body: A coup to overthrow Russian President Vladimir Putin is underway, Ukraine's head of military intelligence has said, adding, "It is impossible to stop it." Major General Kyrylo Budanov said that if Russia lost the war in Ukraine, Putin will be removed and there will be a change of leadership of the Russian Federation.

380.title: 2 Sikh men shot dead in Pakistan, second such incident in 8 months
380.article_body: Two men from Pakistan's minority Sikh community were shot dead by unidentified gunmen in Peshawar city on Sunday, reports said. The deceased men were identified by a policeman as Ranjit Singh and Kanwal Jeet Singh. Gunmen on a motorcycle shot them multiple times before fleeing, the policeman added. This is the second such incident in the last eight months.

381.title: All doesn't seem well in CSK's camp: Aakash Chopra
381.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said CSK are a "strong and successful franchise" but "all doesn't seem to be well" in their camp in the ongoing IPL season. "Ravindra Jadeja left (bio-bubble), then Ambati Rayudu announced retirement before unretiring. There's a different game that's happening there with Rayudu," he added. CSK have lost eight of their 12 games so far.

382.title: Flight to B'luru delayed, passengers wait at Pune Airport for 4 hrs
382.article_body: Passengers onboard the Bengaluru-bound Go First flight were made to wait in the aircraft at Pune Airport for four hours after their flight was delayed. The flight was scheduled to take off at 10:50 pm on May 14. However, the flight took off four hours later at 3:24 am on May 15 due to a technical error.

383.title: Vir Das compares his mom's Lajpat Nagar shopping to Elon Musk buying Twitter
383.article_body: Comedian Vir Das compared his mother's Lajpat Nagar shopping to Elon Musk buying Twitter, and wrote, "Musk is my mom with rockets." Das said his mother "would go into one shop, like something...pretend not to like it too much...and drive the price down". "Other shopkeepers...would offer her better deals," Das said, adding that "she'd come back to the same shop".

384.title: Russia has lost one third of its ground combat force in Ukraine: UK
384.article_body: The UK has estimated that Russia has probably lost "one third of the ground combat force it committed in February". "Despite small-scale initial advances, Russia has failed to achieve substantial territorial gains over...past month whilst sustaining consistently high levels of attrition," it said. Russia is unlikely to dramatically accelerate its rate of advance over the next 30 days, it claimed.

385.title: 4 held with 10 illegal weapons, 15 cartridges in Haryana's Mahendragarh
385.article_body: Four persons were arrested by the Haryana Police after 10 illegal weapons and 15 cartridges were recovered from their possession in Mahendragarh. Following a tip-off that the accused were roaming in the Ateli area with illegal weapons, police conducted a raid and arrested the accused, leading to the recovery of the weapons and cartridges.

386.title: 6 including kids, soldiers killed in suicide bomb blast in Pak
386.article_body: Three children and three soldiers were killed in a suicide bomb blast in Pakistan's North Waziristan district, the media wing of the country's army ISPR said on Sunday. ISPR added that intelligence agencies are "investigating to find out about [the] suicide bomber and his handlers/facilitators", the news agency Dawn reported. The suicide bomber had attacked a military vehicle, officials said.

387.title: Rioters tried to sabotage reporter Akleh's funeral: Israeli Police
387.article_body: Israeli Police said in a statement on Saturday that it'll conduct an investigation after police and mourners carrying Al Jazeera reporter Shireen Abu Akleh's coffin clashed during her funeral ceremony. It added that the police had coordinated with Akleh's family, however, "hundreds of rioters tried to sabotage the ceremony and harm the police". Six people were arrested in the incident.

388.title: Delhi Police summons Raj minister Mahesh Joshi's son by May 18 in rape case
388.article_body: A Delhi Police team that reached Jaipur to arrest Rajasthan Minister Dr Mahesh Joshi's son Rohit in an alleged rape case pasted a summon notice outside his house after he was found absconding. The police asked him to appear before it by May 18. A 23-year-old complainant has alleged that Rohit raped her on several occasions.

389.title: To the most beautiful woman in the world: Shriram Nene on wife Madhuri's b'day
389.article_body: On actress Madhuri Dixit's birthday, her husband Dr Shriram Nene shared a birthday message for her. Taking to Instagram, he wrote, "Happy Birthday to the most beautiful woman in the world, my wife...my best friend! I love you so much and you deserve nothing but the absolute best. Wishing you a wonderful birthday and many amazing years to come, together."

390.title: DMK leader booked after Dalit panchayat official kills self in TN
390.article_body: DMK panchayat union ward councillor V Hari has been booked under SC/ST Act and is facing abetment of suicide charge after a 39-year-old village panchayat official killed himself near Tamil Nadu's Vellore. Hari allegedly refused to return ₹2.5 lakh he took from the victim after failing to provide a job to his brother as promised.

391.title: UAE-based telecom group acquires 9.8% stake in Vodafone Group for $4.4 billion
391.article_body: Emirates Telecommunications Group Company PJSC (e&) has acquired a 9.8% stake in Vodafone Group for $4.4 billion. With this, the UAE-based company has become the largest shareholder in Vodafone, Bloomberg reported. e& said that it has "made the investment in Vodafone to gain significant exposure to a world leader in connectivity and digital services".

392.title: All the boys played fearless cricket: Shreyas on KKR's 54-run vs SRH
392.article_body: Following KKR's 54-run win against SRH in IPL 2022, KKR captain Shreyas Iyer said everyone in the team played fearless cricket. "The mindset we came up with in this game was simply outstanding. All the boys did the right things...everything panned out really well," he added. All-rounder Andre Russell was adjudged 'Player of the Match' for his 3/22 and 49*(28).

393.title: Nepal visit to further deepen time-honoured linkages: PM Modi
393.article_body: A day ahead of his visit to Nepal, PM Narendra Modi said that India's ties with the country are unparalleled. "My visit is intended to celebrate and further deepen these time-honoured linkages that have been fostered through centuries and recorded in our long history of intermingling," he said. PM will visit Lumbini on the occasion of Buddha Purnima.

394.title: Heavy rain warning issued for Kerala, orange alert issued for 6 districts
394.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued warning of heavy rain in Kerala for next five days. An orange alert has been issued for Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam, Pathanamthitta, Alappuzha, Kottayam and Thrissur districts till May 16. IMD advised fishermen to not venture into the sea and said squally weather with wind speed reaching 40-50 kmph is likely to prevail over Kerala coast.

395.title: CSK to bat first against GT, make 4 changes to their playing XI
395.article_body: CSK captain MS Dhoni won the toss and elected to bat first against GT in their IPL 2022 clash on Sunday. Table-toppers GT are fielding the same playing XI, while CSK have made four changes to their playing XI. N Jagadeesan, Prashant Solanki, Mitchell Santner and Matheesha Pathirana have beeing included by CSK.

396.title: Credit not given to Indian content until international recognition: Tanuj
396.article_body: Actor Tanuj Virwani, whose short film 'Parchhaiyaan' will be screened at Cannes, said that not enough credit is given to Indian content until it gets international recognition. He further said there is a lot more that creators need to do to promote short films in India. "There's this common misconception that...a short film...has to be an arthouse film," Tanuj added.

397.title: B'luru BPO employee stabbed to death by drunk friend after argument
397.article_body: A 30-year-old BPO employee in Bengaluru was killed after his friend stabbed him in an inebriated state. The victim, Jayakumar, had taken a loan in his wife's name and his friend Rahil was paying the EMIs. When Rahil forgot to pay one instalment, an argument broke out between them and Rahil stabbed Jayakumar with a knife.

398.title: Williamson should take a break, give SRH captaincy to someone else: Sehwag
398.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag has said SRH captain Kane Williamson should take a break and give the captaincy to someone else for their remaining games in IPL 2022. "How will the team fight when their leader isn't doing well...Abhishek Sharma is trying to make the most of the powerplay, but isn't getting the support from the other end," added Sehwag.

399.title: Indian men's badminton team creates history, wins Thomas Cup for the first time ever
399.article_body: The Indian men's badminton team created history on Sunday after winning Thomas Cup for the first time ever. India won the final 3-0 against defending champions Indonesia. Lakshya Sen and Kidambi Srikanth won their singles' matches in the final against Anthony Sinisuka Ginting and Jonatan Christie, respectively. Meanwhile, Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty won their men's doubles clash.

400.title: CM Baghel suggests Cong leaders to visit temples outside polls too: Reports
400.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel has reportedly suggested at Congress' ongoing 'Chintan Shivir' to visit temples outside the poll cycles as well. "Leaders should participate in religious functions on a regular basis...Only then can perceptions be changed," CM Baghel is learnt to have said. Notably, his suggestion was reportedly supported by several Congress leaders from the Hindi-speaking states.

401.title: Jakhar has to bear brunt of Congress' poor politics: AAP leader
401.article_body: After Sunil Jakhar quit Congress, AAP leader Malwinder Singh Kang said today Jakhar has to bear the brunt of the poor politics of Congress. "The Congress divides people to get votes and today that resulted in the resignation of their former state president," Kang added. Congress has always pursued power through caste and religion-based politics, separating the people, Kang stated.
